text: I love their chicken wings  and the wild mushroom soup. Trust me, you have order  those two items. We love the patio, so cozy.

Paul Martins American Grill - Happy FriYAY  What a wonderful dinner  Smoked Chicken & Wings housemade pesto slaw   St. Louis Style Pork Ribs hoisin glaze, green onions   Petite Steak Frites marinated grass-fed angus top sirloin, herb butter, red wine jus  We highly recommend it

Thought food was good. Had dinner with my brother who does not like cheese. He ordered a Cobb salad and emphasized no cheese. Unfortunately there was blue cheese in his salad. Which blue cheese for cheese  haters has to be the worst cheese you could possibly eat. When presented the blue cheese to the waiter the waiter said no its Egg so he tried tasting it and in fact it was blue cheese. He asked for another salad and unfortunately there was also blue cheese in that salad. When my brother told the waiter he said no its not blue cheese. So we asked to speak to the manager and the manager came over and said " no sir it's not blue cheese i asked the chef". Clearly that's the worst thing you could tell a customer that what they tasted was not correct. So the manager asked "so what do you want me to do" so we told him nothing and ask him to leave. Worst thing you can ever tell a customer.

Set up reservation with manager Timm for  April 13th .  Our party had an excellant lunch , service was great , outdoor dining  was very enjoyable .Would love to come back for dinner  first class  all the way

We went to Paul Martins last night for dinner and were very pleased with our experience.  This is a brand new restaurant created by the owner of PF Changs. Our waiter, JASON, was terrific and super knowledgable providing us descriptive details of the food and suggestions such as a Pinot Noir imported from California.  This restaurant has a woodsy/steakhouse decor mixed with a zen ambiance of candles and stones. It is a casual atmosphere where you can dress up for a three course meal or come in and watch March Madness at the bar.  I highly suggest the salt and pepper prawns appetizer.  Again, most of my credit goes to our waiter who was extremely knowledgable, attentive, and accommodating.  I will be returning back for sure!

Stopped for lunch 1/26/16 after belatedly discovering that our intended nearby restaurant wasn't open for lunch. Great experience from start to finish--from the interior design and finishes of the restaurant space, friendly, professional service staff and our meal. Fond memories of the wild mushroom soup and lunch special enchiladas. My wife enjoyed the fish tacos. Well done Paul Martin's!
Happy Hour here this evening.  Food and service were very good.  Nice place.  I'd return with no hesitation.

went here for the second time tonight. our first experience (it's the food) not so great. so tonight we decided to give it a second shot. sadly, our second time was even worse. the service is okay. we always sit at the bar. it's the food that is extremely disappointing. our bill was $125. we had 4 glasses of wine, an app, a salad and the french dip. the french fries were the best thing we had. our app, the street steak tacos, just okay. loaded with giant bites of fat that i picked away before taking a bite. next our chicken salad and french dip. the chicken salad was BAD. the chicken disintegrated into a paste/powder. i ate about 1/4 of the salad. the french dip served on a focaccia roll. focaccia i've seen for breakfast and lunch sandwiches, not dinner. awful. i had a stomach ache by the time we left the restaurant. we are weekly patrons of houston's across the street and there is a reason. the food is ALWAYS good and the service is beyond amazing. we were looking forward to have a new haunt to enjoy, but houston's will be it, not paul martin's. very disappointing. food BAD.

If I could give this review 4 1/2 stars, I would!  Pulling up, the restaurant looks like it could be just another chain like PF Changs or Cheesecake Factory. However, there's a lovely ambiance once you walk in, and perhaps what helped it to stand out was the wide variety of fresh, locally sourced, organic dishes on the menu. We had reservations, which helped make the wait shorter... it was very crowded, always a good sign. Shannon was our server, and she was great; her friendly personality and eagerness to get us whatever we needed helped to enhance our experience. I got the Meyer Lemon Drop drink which was good. For meals, I started with the Butter Lettuce Salad with blue cheese, candied walnuts, apples, and maple vinaigrette. Very tasty and light enough to be an appetizer. For my main dish, I got the Vegetable Pasta. I was apprehensive about the vague "seasonal vegetables" that it came with, but was pleasantly surprised to find butternut squash, mushrooms, and lemony greens. Great flavor and very filling. Both dishes were delicious. Yum! We got dessert to-go as we were all full. The apple crisp and chocolate cake were both great. Give Paul Martin's a try! Not your average American grill.

My hubby and I had an exceptional lunch here today. We enjoyed great food, excellent wine and superb service. Mike G. and his manager (sorry did not get his name) went above and beyond to explain menu choices, ensure that everyone was done to perfection. We started with the Mushroom Soup, which was sublime. It was, by far, the best mushroom soup I have ever tasted. The table next to us said the same thing. Then I had the brick chicken (swoon) and hubby had the smoked pastrami sandwich. He is STILL talking about it. Instead of fries, he opted for brussel sprouts and I thought he was going to lick the plate. The service and ambiance are a cut above. We will be back within a week or so.  AWESOME!
Great place!  Went there on a Friday night.  Delicious food, fabulous staff.  Christian was incredibly kind and attentive.  Highly recommend!!!

Food was good, however it is another restraint trying to make simple dishes overdone. They do not  have any signature dishes which set them aside from most other restaurants. Service was fair I had to ask for water refills an three separate occasions. Their house bread at the table was nothing special. Do not go here with a group they are not set up to handle larger groups.

I just got back from Paul Martin's American Grill and I can honestly say I have never received worse service at a restaurant.  My wife, 8-year-old son and I were on an extended stay at a nearby hotel and decided to try one of the many well-reviewed restaurants in the area and decided on Paul Martin's.  I don't know who he is, but the place seemed clean, trendy and modern.  We had to wait about 20 minutes, which was okay. The dining area was pretty busy, and the Mexican place next door was also packed.  Our hostess was very nice.  Our waitress arrived promptly, took our drink order and then our food order.  She told us we'd be getting some bread and then she disappeared until we were almost done with our meal.  Well, "disappeared" is an exaggeration - she was still in the restaurant, she just studiously ignored us.  Our son's meal arrived fairly quickly, but after that, we waited (sans the promised bread), and waited... And waited.  Our meals came, and we had to ask the waiter  for the bread we had never received before.  For the life of me, I can't figure out why they brought our son's food out a good half hour before the rest of the table's dinner was ready.   A third staffer then inexplicably replaced my Diet Coke with iced tea.  Our original waitress eventually showed up again, we asked for the check and left.  The food itself was hit or miss.  My wife reports her steak was very good.  My own blackened redfish, however, was chewy and not very flavorful.  Although my son complained that his grilled cheese was not what he was expecting, I tried it and thought it was very good.  Portions were a bit on the small side, but that is almost expected at a trendy place like this.    And the bread, when it eventually came, was also very good.   We could see other tables getting good service (i.e., the wait staff actually paid attention to them and were laughing and smiling). Our waitress, on the other hand, was determined not to even look in our direction.    The only reason I can think of that we received so little attention is that our son was with us.  I didn't see any other children in the place, but it didn't seem that kids were unwelcome and he was well-behaved the entire time.  I must confess, I still don't know who Paul Martin is, but I know we will be staying within walking distance of his restaurant for another 2-4 weeks and we will not be back.  Had our experience been different, we may have eaten there several more times during our stay.  But our first impression was so bad, that we will not be giving him another chance.

The most important place to start: There is a restaurant that has been across the street for a long time with a great record serving up a very similar menu and doing it better. If you have been to this place I speak of across the street, and you like it, don't go to Paul Martin's.   This is a new location for an already established restaurant group, for that reason I do not allow the excuse of being new in regards to our not so great service. While our waitress was nice, she just wasn't very good. If I ask you what items are good on the menu don't tell me what people have been ordering a lot of that night. It doesn't answer my question. A restaurant like this should have had all their employees do a complete tasting of their menu.   After lack of guidance my husband and I collectively wound up with the spinach dip, mushroom soup, steak cobb salad and the short ribs. The meal itself started with olives from the Queen Creek Olive Mill and some seasoned almonds. We enjoyed those and thought we were headed on the path of a good meal, but not so much. Next our waitress brought us "complimentary" bread. She kept saying "complimentary ". It was weird, pretty sure everyone eating at that restaurant understands when the bread hits the table you don't have to pay for it. Anyhow, it wasn't very good bread.   Next should have been our spinach dip but that took 25 minutes so my soup showed up first. It would have actually been very good but half the bowl was filled with a chunk of that not so great bread wedged into my soup. Finally the "spinach dip" came. Ok, if you have had that aforementioned restaurant's spinach dip, DO NOT ORDER THIS. It was whole leaves of spinach that were wilted in a runny béchamel sauce. Not only was the flavor lacking but it was hard to eat since it was whole leaves of spinach. Don't waste your time or money on that one.  The last round for us was my salad and my husband's short ribs. My salad was ok, not bad - but nothing to write home about. The price for what you were getting left something to be desired though. My husband's short ribs were a little bit of short ribs and 20 potatoes worth of mashed potatoes. Guess they make sure their margins are good on that dish. But the biggest issue there was the "sauce". The meat itself was very tender but the plate was like soup with a broth made of soy sauce with meat floating in it. This quantity of soy sauce made the short ribs SO over salted. Short ribs have become very popular on many restaurant menus lately and these were probably my least favorite out of many I've tried lately.   One of the most important things to note here, the bathrooms were FILTHY. I always find it concerning when cleanliness is not a priority in any part of a restaurant.   Final statement: go across the street.

Can't tell you if the food is good or bad. I made reservations on Saturday night for my wife's birthday we arrived on time they seated us right away then made us get back up and gave our table away all with an ATTITUDE. We waited another hour with no information, compassion or table we just ended up leaving. They didn't care at all. I won't go back!!!!! I still can't believe this! I see you have to be a certain color it be respected there!!

Ok before I get started, I should point out that my 2 star review is solely based on the length of time waiting for the main entrée to arrive (to which Paul Martin DID make up for that!) Yes, this place is about 2 weeks old and some of the wait staff (at least where we were seated, on the patio) seemed to be very new.  No problem...I've been a newbie before too.  Our server was a little over the top with the constant mispronunciation of "beautiful", he kept saying "bootiful" and he kept reaching over us to remove empty dishes from the table; he just needs a little more training and seasoning and he'll be fine. The appetizer was a grill artichoke that we shared and it came with this great tasting garlic, pesto and basil aioli.  We devoured that in a short period of time. Next, we split the French Dip sandwich; the meat was a little too fatty and even though we split the dip, I mean c'mon Paul Martin, you can spare a decent amount of the au jus, can't 'cha??  The au jus was served in this way too small and too deep Japanese teacup-like container which it made it difficult to "dip" our French dip.  The horseradish/mayonnaise dip was creamy and good, pretty standard.  The shoestring fries was done well and crispy. We also had the mac and cheese that had pieces of prosciutto in it and it was a unique taste, the broiled top was nice and crunchy! With that being said, our wait time after we got the appetizer was way too long and appeared isolated however that is my biggest pet peeve is the food took too  long AND it seems that I am the one who has to recognize it and point it out to the staff.  Once I let the server know that it's taking a long time, it was then he let his manager know.  Manager addressed us and was nervous about approaching us (he seemed to be a young and new manager as well) and he did his best in explaining the situation but it was painful watching him stumble (ok, not so painful as amusing).   When the food did arrive, it did come out nice and hot so that was a plus!  They also comped our meal as a way of apologizing for the delay.   A golf clap for the food...and since they showed that in the end it is about customer satisfaction, we are going to try Paul Martin again.

Can't say enough great things about this restaurant.  Made reservations for Mother's Day. Arrived a few minutes early and was seated with minutes of our reservation time.   Nice booth   Our server Robert was top notch he explained the menu as well as brunch options.  We had prime rib and fish. Outstanding service. Great food and extremely well run establishment.  Had a wonderful experience.
What a breath of fresh air....not only is the food amazing but the staff....wow. Made me feel like family.

With my family, I went to Paul Martin's during Sunday night eating the Sunday all-day prime rib special for $25. It is not the worst, nor the best either. I have a list of pros and cons to show why I put 4 (and not 5) stars.  Pros: Overall, the food is pretty good. The prime rib special comes with an appetizer of green salad, an entrée of prime rib with mashed potatoes, along with a desert with a shortbread cookie with three scoops of ice cream. Each of the courses were delicious: the green salad has fresh vegetables, along with the dressing blending all the vegetables together perfectly. The prime rib is very tender (with quite a bit of fat for most of our dishes) and the mashed potatoes were neither too mushy nor powdery. I was extremely satisfied by the size of the steak(most of us needed to box the steak) The ice cream is very creamy, and the shortbread cookies were a bit overwhelming, since there was too much sugar. The environment of the restaurant is relaxing, and it makes you feel as if you are in a movie theater. Fortunately, it was bright enough for us to read our menus, but I could use a bit more light.  Cons: The service was somehow disappointing. It was not as good as the last time I went there, since the waiter needed to be reminded multiple times in order to be told that one of our guests is lactose intolerant; he told us the ice cream is gluten-free. The waiters are not as knowledgeable as the managers themselves, since we asked if we could use a gift card that we bought the same day and he wasn't sure. We had to wait for quite a while in order for him to figure that out.  The food is not as good as what I hoped it to be, and I am somehow discouraged. I was not the slightest bit impressed or blown away by what happened today, mostly due to the lousy service. I truly hope that the next time I come back, I will not be dissatisfied again.

"Meh- I've experience better" totally sums it up.  With each course, there was something from at lease one member of my group of four that was returned to the kitchen.  Our artichoke appetizer was not cooked through.  My wife's fish, though ordered medium well was served medium rare.  The apply crisp was just a sugar coma on the plate.  The server was nice and that was the best part of the meal.  They did take care of the dessert to make up for the issues with our other items, but since that wasn't great either, we probably won't be back.

The management and seasoned service at this fine dining establishment are top-notch.  I would recommend checking it out!  75 wines by the glass!  Nice atmosphere on the outdoor patio.  Should get better and better!

We just tried Paul Martin's for the first time with the Arizona Restaurant Week menu. Holy cow was it good! All the food was amazing, particularly the mushroom soup and the braised short ribs. Service was excellent as well, very quick, friendly but not obnoxious. We will certainly be back.

Great food and cocktails!  We went for the Monday night special and had the pork with hoisen sauce. A very good dinner and enjoyable time was had by all!  I've been here for apps and cocktails on previous trips to town and always enjoy it here!

This place seems to have lost some spark since my last visit which was probably over a year ago. I had difficulty finding a menu item that looked appetizing and the value per item just wasn't there. I expected resort expensive but I left unsatisfied and felt like I paid too much. The service was adequate. The food tasted fine. The atmosphere lacked energy. I probably won't come back.

Hi, I go to Paul Martin's with my assistant every Monday night! Not only do they have a fabulous happy hour, our bartender Derek is always sweet, and attentive, giving us great service. He always remembers exactly what we like to order!   I would recommend Paul Martin's for anyone looking for some casual, upscale dining. Go no further than Paul Martin's.

Wow! In my one month stay in Scottsdale,I haven't had food & service as great as I did at Paul Martins! First off the place is a very nice and modern place with a great ambiance, second the food was amazing from the appetizer to desert and third, our server (Joe) was the best! He was knowledgeable and attentive!  We started with the spinach dip which I liked but my husband loved! Then we let our server decide the entree for us and he recommended a great white wine as well as the kale pasta for me and a brick chicken for my husband and to my surprise they were not the most expensive items on the menu. Both the entrees were the best food we had in our entire stay! Then we went for the Apple crisp as our server recommend and it was amazing! It can definitely cure anyone's sweet tooth. I don't know who Paul Martin is but he is definitely doing a great job with his food and staff! I wish I would have found this place earlier in our stay, but now we know our spot when we visit again!

We made reservations for our group of 4 on opentable - especially nice since it was for Mothers Day.  They called Day before to confirm - also a nice touch.   We had an amazing brunch experience.  Excellent service!  Our table ordered off the brunch menu, prime rib Sunday special and dinner menu.  Impressive that they had offerings from all 3 menus.   Paul Martins is an excellent restaurant and always a treat to dine there.  Every time I go I remind myself that we need to go more often!

Amazing service here, everyone is friendly. Especially this waitress named Heather. She is on par with everything. I now make this one of my favorite restaurants and will request her when I visit. The food is made fresh which my stomach is really sensitive and I can only do fresh. Try the calamari appetizer and the shrimp pasta.

Paul Martin's used to be J Alexanders and I liked the old restaurant. Food was very good at typical higher end Scottsdale prices. $14 cheeseburgers. $28 entrees. $8 Carrot cake was awesome. I was disappointed to see it go out of business.  Now we have a California restaurant in it's place. I knew that the second I sat down at the bar. The place mat gave me the entire lowdown on the chickens. You know, the fact that they are not kept in cages. Is this important to you? Me neither. I just want a good meal with friendly service, nice atmosphere and a decent price. In this case, 3 out of four ain't bad.   It's California cuisine because it's food with a social conscience that beats you over the head. Free range chickens, ethical farming, fair trade espressos... you get the idea. if you love that sort of stuff (and in reality, I know it's probably your girlfriend who does) than bon appetit. Have a not very large and average tasting $15.50 cheeseburger (cheese is extra) and sleep better because the chickens aren't in cages.  The place does have a nice atmosphere, but so does Houston's across the street and so did J Alexanders.  Very friendly wait staff. Food delivery was quick. Beer selection is limited. Maybe the wine list was better. Don't know. Not a wine guy.  I left wishing I had been able to find a seat at "Cold Beer and Cheeseburgers" in old town Scottsdale. Good food at a decent price. Do they have ethically farmed local ingredients? They don't say and in all honesty I couldn't care less.

After visiting this stylish new restaurant three times I was disappointed in the food three times.   First time: After struggling to find anything on the menu that appealed to me, I ordered the fish tacos.  I was surprised to see the tacos made with Salmon.  If I wanted Salmon I would have ordered Salmon.  They were just ok but,  not what I had hoped for.  Second time:  I ordered a hamburger.  It was difficult to cut it in half as I hit on a very tough piece of meat.  Then, when I was eating it, I bit on a tough piece that I could not chew so I had to spit it out.  Lost my appetite for the rest of the meal.  Third time: Got to be better this time right??  I odered Tortilla Soup.  Huge  disappointment.  The bowl was small, there were VERY few pieces of chicken but, one the the pieces was a chunk of fat that had to  be spit out!!  Summary:  Disappointed in the food,  prices too high, happy hour below average. Many better restaurnants in town.  Paul Flemming.....how did you miss on this one?   My recommendation:  For great Tortilla Soup  go to  Roaring Fork.  For all other food, you can't go wrong at Houston's.  Nan

We will not go back. Let's start with the music; totally inappropriate. Music should be more piano bar type instead of rock music. Most of the servers uniforms were too small and their bellies were all hanging out. We received three thin slices for two people. Really chintzyh! The house dressing was so spicy our lips were on fire through the dinner. The chocolate ice cream was gritty! I didn't like it. The salt shaker was a paper salt shaker?? I'd spend the extra money and go to Chart House.

We went there for New Years Eve. James was our server. He was great and the food was great. We had the salt and pepper prawns with the grilled salmon. The salmon was simple and one of the best I have tasted! We ended with the pear and huckleberry cobbler - great stuff!

My boyfriend and I went to Paul Martin's for the first time this evening. We were excited to try something new, but received the worst service I have ever experienced. It took a long time for the waitress to take our drink order. My boyfriend waited 20 mins to get his beer. After sometime we noticed tables around us had received complimentary bread, but none was offered to us. We had to ask. From the time we ordered our entrees it took us an hour to receive our meal. In this time a family of 4 was seated next to us. They ordered, received their meals and paid for their meals and we were still waiting. The food was not worth the wait. Our side salads were lettuce with approximately 5 grape tomatoes. The fish was over cooked. Our bill was very overpriced for the quality of food and service we received. We will not be returning or recommending this restaurant.

I stopped in for lunch and sat at the bar with a friend, the bartender was really friendly, we told him it was our first time and weren't sure what to order. He suggested the pastrami sandwich "which I had" omg best sandwich I've ever had, the fresh ground mustard had me, not to mention the grass Feed beef. I mostly Definitely recommend trying the sandwich, I will be back to explore more of the menu.

My husband had a hamburger and I had the polenta and vegetable dish with chicken.  We also ordered grilled cauliflower.  It was all very good.  And the waiter was charming.  Will go back next time we are in town.

Cedar planked salmon,  chimmichuri chicken and mac & cheese.  Awesome dinner for 2.  The best though was the mesquite grilled avocado appetizer - totally yummy!  Great service, great food - what more could you want?

We live in Denver and come to visit Scottsdale once or twice a year. Dinner at Paul Martin's is always required, and we've never been disappointed. Contrary to what another review said, we've always found the service staff friendly and welcoming. Our latest dinner there was after a harrowing round of golf, and settling down in a booth felt like coming home. One of the features you have to notice is the quality of the butcher-block table tops. They practically glow, they're so clean. We started by sharing a grilled artichoke with aioli (sp?) sauce. I don't know how they make this dish so good, but it's better here than any others we've tried--and we've tried it often! My husband had the rib plate, with 8 big, meaty ribs and sides of coleslaw and french fries. He practically licked the plate! I had the Chesapeake Bay salmon, but put in a special request for spinach as a side, rather than couscous. I got the dish just as ordered, and it was delicious. The salmon was perfectly cooked, with a light onion sauce that was great. For dessert we shared 3 scoops of ice cream with shortbread cookies. The only shortcoming of the meal was the caramel ice cream, which was low on caramel taste or feel. The chocolate and vanilla flavors were great, and the shortbread cookies wonderful. Throughout our meal, our waitress and the rest of the waitstaff were cheerful and attentive. Yes, it was a pricey meal, but less than we had expected, and worth every cent of it! It remains our Phoenix favorite!

Overall impression: Over-rated and over-priced for the quality of food.   Atmosphere: Great remodel of the old J. Alexander's with a more upscale feel. Layout is open with a bar in the rear that includes a few tables and lots of bar seating. When we were there it was quiet and slow. Tables are set nicely. Atmosphere is upscale.   Service: Service was attentive and friendly. Policies don't seem as welcoming. We were served a tiny dish of olives (1" round dish that had 4 or 5 pea sized olives in it...maybe 1 tablespoon of olives). We asked if we could have more but were told that they would have to charge us $5 for another dish. If this had been a large dish of olives, such as the free plate of bread and olives that they serve at Houston's across the street, I could understand the charge, but this was a tablespoon of olives! We asked for bread, got 3 half-slices slices of bread which was good but almost certainly not baked in house.   Menu: Prices are very high but comparable to what you would find in steak houses in the area; however, the food is more casual (burgers, mac & cheese, spinach dip, french dip) so prices seem on the high end of what they should be. Starters such as cheese plate are $12 per person, spinach dip $14, and shrimp appetizer, $17. Entrees range from $13 for a veggie burger ($14 for regular meat burger), and an additional $6 for fries with that burger, and they go up to $39 for a NY steak.  I had the house made polenta and vegetables in tomato creme. The veggies were greasy overcooked. I was not able to cut them with my knife. The polenta was burnt (not just charred but black). It all sat in a lot of tomato creme which seemed to clash with the flavors of the grilled veggies. When the server asked how our food was, I said it was okay but I wondered if the polenta was supposed to be served that charred. The manager saw the polenta, apologized, and removed it. My dining companion had the chicken with mashed potatoes and liked it ($21). For dessert we had banana creme pie. Also disappointing. The crust had a thin ribbon of ganache on the bottom, topped by about 1/2" of vanilla cream with a few slices of banana, topped with almost an inch of unsweetened whipped creme.  I wanted to like this dessert but it was bland. We left half of it on the plate.   We probably won't return. I would instead head over to Houstons for casual dining or Eddie Vs for steaks and seafood. Even though the prices were similar to other restaurants in the area, the quality was not.

Went here for a Birthday dinner - perfect spot for this!!! I had the homemade lemonade, it was full of flavor! Beware of the  salted butter with the starter bread, it almost kicked me on the ground. They also start you off with a small cup of almonds and olives. Not a fan of olives but the almonds are so nice. I chose the Marinated Skirt Steak for dinner and traded out the fries for mac and cheese. The steak was great, very little fat and flavorful. Mac and cheese was AMAZING!!! I would come here again!

Came here last night with a bunch of friends after reading the yelp reviews. Thought it would be a good place to try. The food is really good! I had the Blackened Ribeye Steak and it was delicious! I highly recommend that steak. The reason why I gave this place only 4 stars is because the water glasses are too small and the service was just okay. I had to ask multiple times for water. In a restaurant like this, you shouldn't have to ask for water.
A great american restuarant. The burger is the best in the valley. Also like the BLT with great fries. You won't be disappointed with other items on the menu. The service is just great.

Bad service. I just went to HAPPY HOUR at Paul Martins with a friend. I am allergic to quite a few things so before we ordered, I gave the waitress a card that listed my allergies and she said she would take it back to the kitchen. I said ok as I pointed to the happy hour menu and mentioned that any thing on there would be good. They already have a few gluten free options, so I figured they could make some substitutions on one of the hh appetizers like they had in the past. When she came back she said they could do salmon and cauliflower to which I asked if that was an entree and then replied that I had a late lunch that was salmon and that I wasn't really that hungry and would prefer an appetizer. So she suggested seared ahi tuna. I asked if it was an entrée and she said that that was a salad. So I said yes that sounds good- I figure a small appetizer salad with some ahi tuna. No. A $28 salad.  I clearly came in for happy hour and told her I wasn't that hungry and left with a bill over $40. I suppose I should have asked how much it was, but I never have had a problem like this in the past. Also, when I mentioned it to her, she argued with me about it. The salad was good, but not really a "salad" and she should not have only suggested very expensive meals. I have had happy hour appetizers that are free from all of my allergies before. The meal tasted great though, props to the chefs!

AmEx sent me a promotion for this place so I decided to check it out.  I got the skirt steak, the meat was very very good, cooked to perfection and very well seasoned.  Everything on the plate was great except for the portion.  I know its an upscale restaurant, but for almost 30 dollars you get 3-4 little pieces of steak, a bit disappointing. I also ordered the banana cream pie like someone recommended here, but I was not a fan, the cream tasted like it had been stored uncovered in the fridge with onions and garlic, not very pleasant.  The service was very good.  I will probably wont go again for food, maybe for a drink during happy hour since the place is really nice and has a trendy atmosphere.

A friend and I decided to try Paul Martin's during restaurant week. Great choice. Neither of us had been here before but I'll certainly be back.  We both ordered from the restaurant week menu. I had a wonderful wild mushroom soup and  grilled salmon. My friend had kale salad and short ribs. Both were prepared well and served hot. We had a great server who graciously packaged up our leftovers. We both commented on the nice ambience, and choice of music.

I really wanted to like this place.  We showed up around 6:00 pm for their advertised "Taste of Paul Martin's" happy hour menu.  I asked the hostess if it mattered where we sat for that menu.  Well, it did.  You have your choice of the high-top tables around the perimeter, the communal tables (like picnic tables with people packed in like sardines) or the bar.  As she pointed out, they were all full.   So I asked if we could be put on a waiting list.  No, they don't do that.  I asked if we could have made a reservation.  They don't do that either.  So, I said, "so what are we supposed to do, stand in front of a table & wait until the people leave?"  And the answer, shockingly, was unfortunately that's pretty much what you have to do.  She was sorry that was how it is, but that's how  it is.  So if a table opens & there are others waiting, whoever can run the fastest gets the table?  Is this any way to run a business of any kind, let alone a restaurant in Scottsdale?  We were also offered the outside patio, which NO one was sitting at.  Why, you might ask?  Because it's August and it's 106 degrees out and they don't even have any misters.  I am not that desperate to eat in their establishment.  We waited for a little while and realized it was a total waste of a trip & waste of time, so we left.  We will not be returning.  I have a feeling if I had not asked about the seating for the happy hour menu, we would have not been told and then been up-sold to their "dinner menu" and probably would have still ended up leaving anyway.  I would love to hear anyone else's experience with their happy hour seating.

Walked out before even ordering.  They were not busy at all but waitress took FOREVER just to bring drinks.  By that time we had changed our mid.  Very pricey and limited menu.  The name 'American Grill' can be deceptive.  Try 'Newport Beach overpriced nuevo American but mostly just trendy'...

Came into the restaurant without a reservation on a Saturday with my wife and 7 year old son.  Was seated promptly despite not having reservations.  The service was efficient and friendly and very accommodating towards my child.  Although there was no children's menu, waiter helped us figure out a good option.  Ordered the salmon and steak and must say to our surprise it was beyond delicious.  Plus my son's mac & cheese was outstanding.  For those like us visiting the area for vacation, this is a great place to spend a meal.  With all of the options in Scottsdale and navigating local culture and attitude this was a no brainer.

First time yelp review, precipitated by a horrible dining experience. To be brief, here are the facts. Reservation made for 7:15, seated @ 7:45. Service so incompetent, we had to flag down another member of the wait staff to take our order; so all we have on the table is water @ 1 hour after our reservation. When dinner finally arrived, we hit the trifecta. Reservation not honored, lousy service, and the piece de resistance, crappy food. Would of given a zero star rating if I could, so buyer beware.
One of the Best burgers  in town, in addition to phenomenal customer service.  Love love love this place!
Exceptional service, food, and delicious drinks!! I'm craving the grilled artichoke...wow such tasteful food
Thefreeters were very nice.  Our waiter, Courtney was friendly and very attentive.  He made some great drink recommendations.  The bread on the hamburger is very good.  This is a great place to eat!
Best burger I've ever had! Only complaint was the fries were a little salty for my taste.. That's the worst of it.. Friendly staff.. Swanky atmosphere.. Prices weren't unreasonable..
An excellent place for any occasion. Besides the great entrees, grilled artichoke was awesome. Angelo was on top of his game with excellent service and recommendations.

Service - Exceptional   Food - Mediocre   Drinks - All were tasteful and well made  Atmosphere - Elegant and booths were comfy   Everything was great except the food was just ok.. Slightly disappointed. We came here for Valentines dinner but probably won't drive 40 mins to eat. Definitely will stop by for happy hour drinks though if in the area..

Loved the food...service was excellent...a very cozy and comfortable restaurant. Also great patio seating.  One big problem was that they had nothing Vegan on the menu so it was very hard to put together a meal for myself. I'm hoping that you will follow suit and be adding some plant base items in the near future to go along with the rest of your wonderful menu choices.

Been there couple times. Had the dinner salmon, it is one of the best ways I've ever had salmon. I can't wait to go back for more. But, just FYI it's only at dinner! They need to have as a Sunday special!

We decided to try this place Monday as we knew it changed. Got seated right away and our waiter came quickly. Nice gentleman named Michael. Very pleasant. He explained Monday night was $49 wine/dinner night for two. We could pick ANY entree and any bottle of wine that had a box next to it. Along with that was two salads included. We were "confused." HAHA We were excited that we stumbled onto such a great deal. We selected a bottle of AZ wine which cost more then the deal deal, but again, it was included! The salads were local, organic greens with champagne vinaigrette. Very fresh and nice size serving. We had the Chimichurri Hanger Steak that came with perfect shoestring fries and they were hot! Nice compliment to the perfectly cooked steak. We also tried the St Louis Style Ribs with corn on the cob. Ribs we tasty, not dry. The corn had a little too much cheese but it was good. The manager, Claude checked on us twice and we told him we would be back and how the service is impeccable and the food delish! There was also another manager who came by as well. They made sure our dining experience was a good one and it was. We will be back on a Monday. Best deal on town!

Superb food and terrific staff.  I ordered the ribeye steak and it was cooked perfectly on their mesquite grill. The steak was simply damn good and will make one ponder about replacing their own backyard charcoal grill for a mesquite burner.   I was impressed by the staff, specifically the manner in which they worked together. From busboys clearing dishes to drinks being brought out, more restaurants could follow the training model of Paul Martin's American Grill.  It was in the higher end of price ranges, but for the area the cost seems comparable. It's not somewhere that I would go regularly for drinks because of the price. But rather a place to enjoy on occasion

What a let down, Martin's quality falls well short of their pricing.  Ribeye might be one step above Applebee's.  Order a $40 ribeye and one would expect quality, instead you're  greeted with a grainy borderline New York cut.  They preach "free range", "locally grown", and "made from scratch" all catchy tag lines, but they don't match what is served on your plate.  Save your money, and try elsewhere.

Went to Paul Martin's for dinner and drinks with some work colleagues tonight and one of my co-workers asked about possibly ordering off the happy hour menu with our group who was all ordering dinner. Our waitress Amy who extremely accommodating said she would ask her manager for permission. The manager came over and told our group no there is no ordering of happy hour allowed in the dining room and he would not even allow the member of our group to walk to the bar and get a happy hour drink and bring it back to our table where the entire rest of the group was ordering food. I have been in restaurant management for 8 years and know how to handle customers and this situation was handled horribly. I'm from California and have worked in high end restaurants for years. The manager came over and basically whispered so other guests wouldn't hear. The name of the manager at the establishment was Clyde. The only reason I am giving this establishment a 3 star review is our amazing waitress Amy who did an outstanding job of handling the situation and keeping us in the restaurant after the extremely abhorrent handling by the manager.
Went here with some friends visiting from Chicago, good food and service was excellent.

I recently placed two orders to go. Both times the person on the phone was unfamiliar with the menu, and I had to wait on hold for her to go back and forth to ask basic questions. Both times I picked up the orders, they were incorrect. The first one was missing food--half the order. The second one had the French Dip prepared without following my request for additions. The au jus was way too salty, almost inedible. The mac and cheese was also too salty, probably because the ratio of prosciutto to pasta wasn't well balanced, which is a shame since this is one of the few places that uses good cheddar. Better fries could be had at most fast food restaurants. And the banana cream pie is certainly not worth the calories or money. Do yourself a favor and patronize any number of decent Scottsdale restaurants over this one, which is overpriced and overrated. Might I suggest Roka Akor just up the street?
Excellent Restaurant Week selection. Beautiful decor, tasty food and excellent service. Our server, Angelo was knowledgeable and friendly. It could not have been better.

I love coming here for HH whenever I am in Scottsdale for work.  The food is very well priced considering it's on the fancy side.  I love the burger here.  Drink prices are also great and the bartenders here know what they are doing.  Highly recommend for HH.

Had a fantastic lunch experience here.  Dark warm woods in the interior.  Felt like a lodge with modern accents (reminded me of Disneyland's Grand Californian Hotel).    My friend & I tried the Bistro Burgers (adding avocado and Arizona cheddar - a must).  As a fan of both Fleming's and Ruth Chris' burgers, I have found a new favorite burger in the valley!   Comes with fries (get the sweet potato - perfectly cooked and very flavorful).  Or try the house-made coleslaw - amazing.  We added a side of grilled corn with chilli aoli & cotija cheese - the description alone should tempt you...and it delivers big on flavor.    Capped it off by sharing a piece of the Devil's Food Cake - added a scoop of vanilla ice cream per server's recommendation - thanks Michelle! perfect compliment to the rich dark chocolate ganache in the cake.  Will be back soon!

Our server was the best, I mean over the top kind of service and I always appreciate over the top kind of service.  This might sound odd to you but we ordered a side of broccolini and I'm still dreaming about it.  It was so simple, yet sometimes the simplest of flavors seem to make my tastebuds scream the most.  So tip, get the broccolini all to yourself.  We also ordered a side of the macaroni and cheese, which was creamy, crunchy (from the prosciutto) and also a favorite.  My dish was the winner for the night.  The short ribs were tender and melt in your mouth good, that with the broccolini, what more do you need.  My husband enjoyed his skirt steak but was disappointed that the menu said potatoes as the side and he ended up with three huge tomatoes on his plate.

Had dinner at Paul Martin's for the first time on Saturday night... the service, the ambience, the food and the cocktails were outstanding.  Our server was knowledgeable, helpful, friendly and efficient.  Definitely will go back, and highly recommend reservations as it was quite busy. Parking is a little shy, however, the valet service is free and the guys at the valet were extremely friendly and quick..
We went here with our kids and our particular mom. The staff was amazing and so accommodating. The food was delicious and fast. We will definitely go back!
The skirt steak had so much flavor! I wanted more of it!!  The roasted chicken was delicious with mashed potatoes as well. Great deal two entrees and a bottle of wine for $49:)

Amazing, gourmet-style food, with the additional distinction of being of the organic/natural variety.  And so much the better, right?  Probably more of a 4.5 star than 5, but Yelp doesn't offer half stars.

Had a really nice anniversary dinner with my husband.  The service was great, atmosphere nice, a little loud, but it was a Saturday night.  The food was spot on...fresh, tasty and came quickly.  They even gave us a desert for our occasion.  We'll definitely go back with friends for a nice night out.

Great food and great service! Myhanh took great care of us. I came with my family - who can be a bit difficult to serve - and we had a wonderful experience. I don't remember the last time I heard my grandfather say that he was truly pleased with a restaurant as he used to be an owner of restaurants! Thanks for the great food and phenomenal service!

We visited this very sexy and modern restaurant for dinner last Saturday evening.  We were seated on the patio which had heaters if necessary.  Our server was Caryn, and she was on her toes at all times.  She definitely knows her menu and made many recommendations on the wine and the food.  She did point out the 3 course special which consists of a $30 per person menu + $5 glass of wine.  We both ordered the short ribs with the kale salad and ice cream and short bread cookies for dessert.  This was my first experience with kale salad and it will not be the last - it was delicious!  The meat on the ribs melted in your mouth as did the fluffy mashed potatoes.  The manager brought me the wine and he checked in with us later during the meal.  Caryn was delightful as our server and was both pleasant and interesting.  She conveys the mood of the restaurant - efficient, young, hip and in touch with the surroundings.  We left the restaurant very satisfied with our experience!

My Husband and I were looking at different restaurants to have a small rehearsal dinner for family coming out of town. We so happened to stop at Paul Martin's for lunch and Clyde took great care of us from beginning to end- We knew this was a great place to bring our out of state friends and family. The day of the rehearsal dinner Clyde continued to take care of us and he made sure everything was perfect. We were so satisfied with the food and service that we continue to go back and bring the family to eat at Paul Martin's.

We came here for the first time for lunch during Spring Training. The food was great!  It was also nice to know that they make everything from scratch and use local ingredients. We had the kale Caesar salad, wild mushroom soup and the grilled salmon sandwich with sweet potato fries. Everything was great and very tasty. Service was also great. They accidentally served regular fries with the sandwich and they immediately apologized and brought out a basket of sweet potato fries. Definitely recommended and we will be back.

A celebratory birthday dinner turned into an odd experience where we had to manage our meal throughout the evening.  While appetizers went well, and I highly recommend the fresh flavorful oysters, we were well through the course before the drinks we ordered upon seating finally arrived.  Our dinner orders were pretty straightforward: two rib eyes and two strips all medium, one salmon and one redfish.  Two servers arrived asking "Ribeyes?" and we directed them.  This was the first negative tipoff - a restaurant of this kind should know who has ordered which dish and deliver them correctly.  In the longer than usual few minutes before the remaining dishes arrived, we all looked at the ribeyes with curiosity as they most definitely were not ribeyes.  Then came the servers with the strips (again asking who should get them) and we took the opportunity to swap the strip steaks (cleverly disguised as ribeyes) with the ribeyes (cleverly disguised as strip steaks).  Finally, a server arrived asking "Salmon?" and deposited Redfish in front of me and the final dish of Salmon was deposited in front of the birthday girl, who had ordered Redfish.  It equated to a very frenetic and chaotic orchestration which made everyone uncomfortable.  After completing our main dish swap party we found the following:  Ribeyes - very thin (1/2" at best) and well done Strips - thick and cooked perfectly, mashed potatoes dry and crusty Salmon - cooked as requested but with a mustard glaze that sat too long and became dry and crusty Redfish - served cold  Our waiter handled the issues well, refiring ribeyes (now reordered as strips, as the thinness of the ribeye would make medium doneness difficult) and redfish appropriately and refilling drinks on the house, however, we celebrated this birthday eating dinner in 3 shifts as meals reappeared at varying times (can't coordinate the refires to arrive together?).  After the last entree was finished the manager stopped by to let us know he was buying the ribeye dinners.  Generous and appreciated but then dessert was served (all good, banana cream pie delicious) and cappuccinos arrived after dessert was finished.  We are of mixed opinions on whether to give Paul Martin's another chance.  What they did well was fantastic but many, many missteps made it difficult to enjoy the occasion.

6-7-2015 We had the most fabulous dinner! It was a last minute decision to drop in at Paul Martin's and it was the best meal of during our week in Scottsdale.  I had the skirt steak and husband had the brick chicken.  We ended with a shared piece of the banana cream pie.  The service was outstanding.  The food was so delicious.  AND the drinks were so fresh we ordered a second round.  Don't pass up this restaurant.  You will not be disappointed.

1st time eating here and everything was delicious!  Started with the salt n pepper shrimp as an appetizer.  Enjoyed the warm hand towels they brought out after.  Skirt steak and cedar plank salmon were both AMAZING!  Mac n cheese was good, my least favorite of everything... Banana creme pie for desert had a small layer of chocolate on the crust.  Will be back for sure!

Went with a group last night and was surprised we were able to get in.  The service was very.....awkward.  It must have been our servers first serving job as well.  I chalked this up to being new so I'm not deducting anything.    Ordered the butchers board and appreciated the explanation about the different meats and cheeses. The "mine" bleu cheese was the best.  Ordered the prime strip and it was excellent.  Substituted the mashed potatoes and they were good but my friend said hers were cold.  She also just likes to complain.    Banana cream pie was good.  Had a kick to it.     Will be back again.

These were the Steak and Bacon Tacos with Avocado and Cucumber Salad absolutely mouth watering!  I apologize I didn't snap a picture of the Lemon Creme Burle with home made shortbread cookies before the plate was empty a must try.  Out waiter Cortney was on point and the patio was extremely comfortable

Taco Tuesday here rocks! Yes, the tacos are small but they are DELISH! They offer, salmon, beef (my two favorites) and pork for $2 each. They come on fresh, wonderfully chewy corn tortillas and you can order as many or a few as you like. They also have specials on margaritas made with house-made sweet & sour. I almost always get heartburn from margaritas, but not these, they are quality. This deal is only offered in the bar, but it lasts all day and night.   Their happy hour is also a great deal and I love the steak salad for lunch.
Great food.  We had 4 kids and they gave us a private room service was good. Kids food was good too.

Decided try this place out with  1st arrived wasn T sure cause place was pretty empty but the site is stay anyways cause it was kind of late on a  Tuesday our server Michael was great had some great suggestions on the meaning the fried chicken was the best crispy juicy and had a spicy crust the mashed potatoes  Are a must Super fluffy and lots of butter I also had a   Rib eye steak that was OK not the best I've ever had    I think it was just not enough   Marbling have lots of fat I'm outside Probly when not   go back for the stakes  Finish that off With a ice cream sundae There is mediocre nothing special what's get that next time over all but go back again just for that fried chicken

This restaurant is exceptional! Food and service are top notch. The Moscow Mules were  refreshing, entrees were delicious and perfectly prepared. Dessert was the Lemon Creme Brulee. We will definitely be back...again and again!

I have been to Paul Martins a number of times. Every meal I have had has been delicious. The pork chop is succulent, the cedar plank salmon is delicious all the starters are great. The bar is well stocked and both spirits and wine. The staff is very professional and they take pride in providing a good dining experience. I highly recommend this restaurant.

First time there was on a Sunday and everything was GREAT!  They accept reservations!  We had 2 waiters (one in training) both were very attentive even as they got very busy.  They explained that everything is made to order and not pre-cooked and thrown on a plate.    We were extremely impressed with all the dishes that came out...even the vegetarian plate for my wife.  The char on the veggies from the grill made them AMAZING!  Their bartender even knows how to properly make an Old Fashioned (so many can't).  They even tossed in a free desert for my wife and I for our anniversary!  No question, we will be coming back!

We went here the other night to celebrate a birthday. We had an amazing dinner. My only complaint would be that they had made a mistake and undercooked some chicken for one friend at our table. They did take it off the bill. Still an awesome place and we will be back again.

My husband and I stopped in to eat at Paul Martins tonight. He had the ribeye, which was the best steak ever. I had the fish tacos that were served with fresh cilantro, radish, and tomatoes; along with aoli sauce. They were delicious. Our service was excellent! The bread was whole grain and served warm. Irresistable....

I have been here several times and I absolutely love it. The food is amazing, the atmosphere is nice, and the service is consistently on point. I also LOVE that the majority of the food is local and organic. I had a girls night there this past weekend and we had a blast, the manager Mike came by and was super nice. My favorites here: mushroom burger, mushroom soup, kale Ceaser, the steak w/ chimichurri, short ribs, banana cream pie, chocolate cake and there is a lemon champagne cocktail that is delish!!
Trent A (amazing bartender)  The most attentive and fun bartender I've had in a long time really made our experience special.   A must is the happy hour with the smoked wings amazing!!

Bad. Just plain bad, especially for the price.  Food:  Appetizers Spinach dip- gross. Honestly disgusting. Most spinach dip is thick with melted cheese, cream, chopped spinach, etc. This was whole pieces of spinach in what seemed to be Campbells cream of (?) soup and some melted cheese on top. Comes with bread, not a dipping appetizer, I had to use a spoon to ladel some onto my bread.  Cheese board: pretty good. Nice variety of cheeses and meats, though it did not come with any additional bread or crackers. They price it at $12/person, which is weird and a little confusing (does each person have to pay $12 or can you just order one "person" for the whole table?). The latter is true and we ordered 2 "people" for 5 of us and it was enough.   Calamari: my favorite part of the meal. Fried really nicely and great flavor.  Entrees Prime new York steak: $42. Absolutely not worth $42. I ordered MR and it came medium. Did not taste like a high quality steak. Came with spinach with no flavor and fried potatoes which were the best part of the plate.  French dip: OK but not great. Fairly juicy but not what i would expect from a restaurant like this. The horseradish had the consistency of ranch and did not have much flavor. Fries were very good.  Short rib: very juicy. No real complaints but it didn't blow me away.   Two others ordered fish plates which I did not try. However both were swimming in some sort of juice/sauce and neither person finished their plate.  Dessert Chocolate cake: solid. Chocolate lovers dream  Drinks: Bloody Mary: spicy (good for me) but it was very thin looking and lacked flavor. Even my wife (who hates BM's) mentioned that it looked thin  Margarita: terrible. It was just sweet and sour and silver tequila. No gran marnier or orange juice or anything that resembled fresh juice. Supposedly the sweet and sour is made in house, but its a very poor recipe if that's true.   Service: Complete garbage for the prices they charge. We waited 5 minutes (at least) from the time we sat until anyone greeted us and took drink orders. Another 5 minutes or so to actually get drinks. Then probably 15 minutes before he came back to get our food orders, by then we just ordered our food an appetizers together.   The servers dont seem to help each other out much either. Each time food and drinks were brought to the table, our server had to make 2 trips.   Drink refills were relatively slow, but not terrible. Table management was awful. My margarita glass was empty after 15 minutes and then sat on the table for the rest of the meal until we stood up. One ordered wine but her wine glass was still removed from the table (prior to being served her first glass). When he brought the wine he had to go back to get another glass.   Overall we were there for 2 hours. Will never go back. If you want to pay the same amount for dinner but get a quality meal and excellent service, go across the street. If you want to get the same service and food but don't want to pay the $$$, go to....any chain restaurant of your choice.

STEPHEN IS THE BEST. I came from out of town for my birthday & Stephen was such a great server -- may I say the best I've ever had. You don't see many people like that. He made us laugh and we had such a great conversation! He was very attentive also.   I also was impressed when the manager came by and asked how everything was going and if there was anything he could do. My friend and I are both fairly young and we never get that sort of attention.   The wait for food was quick & the food was yummy!

Was here 2 separate times. On both occasions the servers were amazing (John and Paul) the food was amazing (American Burger and Grilled a chicken Skewers) and the drink (Bistro Cosmo) was amazing! Would definitely come back here again!

I was so disappointed that one of my favorite restaurants did a less than a perfect job I wrote a less than perfect review.  I have since heard from the management with regrets and assurances that my next visit will see improvements all around.  I look forward to visiting one of my favorites again and soon!  Thank you for the caring reply.  I feel badly that I reacted so harshly. Everyone has a bad day - even me!
Food overall was well liked. Very clean and neat atmosphere with a great out door patio when the temperature is right. Salt and pepper shrimp are tasty(not pictured because they were eaten to fast)

One of our new favorite places to eat in town .. Amy H. Our server was great :) made it for an awesome experience :) thank you again Amy H.  Try their Pan roasted cauliflower as one of your sides .. Yum yum

Fantastic dinner service. The customer service here is top notch and their food is some of the best I've had. My girlfriend and I were in Scottsdale for vacation and decided on Paul Martin's for dinner - so glad we did.  We sat at the bar for a few cocktails and some of the salt and pepper shrimp. They had live music and the musical guest was excellent.    Our Bar tender was very courteous and engaged in some friendly conversation with us while we enjoyed our drinks.  The manager stopped over after we got our appetizer and checked in with us to make sure we were enjoying everything.  I thought that was great.  Once we sat at our table our server was absolutely awesome and very knowledgeable of the items on the menu. My girlfriend ordered the steelhead and I must say after I had a bite I wanted to eat the whole thing. It was perfectly cooked and seasoned just perfectly.  I had the steak tenderloin (med rare) and it was done exactly how I wanted. We had such a great exreperience. Paul Martin's does everything right. Thank you for being such a classy, well-run, high quality restaurant. If I ran a restaurant I would want it to be run just like this place.   Cheers!

Probably the best Cobb salad I've ever had. I ordered it with chicken instead of the steak. It was huge, which it should be for $18. That's the only reason I'm taking off a star. I feel like a salad should be at most $15. The dressing was so good! It was blue cheese with a lot of dill. Sounds kind of weird but it was amazing. I'm a salad lover and if you are too, you know how hard it can be to have the perfect dressing! This salad doesn't disappoint. We also ordered the banana cream pie and again it was one of the best I've ever had. You could tell it was hand made. It wasn't super sweet like you would expect, which made it that much better. Highly recommend it! $10 a slice and a good size for two people.   This restaurant has really great food! I just wish they weren't overpriced. The decor is nice and it's a great place for a date night or w friends but I still feel like they could take off $3-$5 from every meal and it would be more reasonable. I don't think there was much of anything under $20 on the menu. Most was priced much higher than that.

Flew in from Houston today and decided to check out this restaurant for dinner.  The hostesses were very friendly and suggested the $49 Monday night special that includes 2 salads, 2 entrees, and a bottle of wine. Awesome deal! Our server Angelo was great and the food was incredible.  We highly recommend the cedar plank salmon and the shrimp pasta dish.

This is the best food I've had in a long time!! I went here when visiting family in Arizona and the food, service, and atmosphere was amazing!! I will definitely come here again on my next visit to AZ! 10 stars

I feel a few years ago Paul Martin's used to be a great night out. Lately seems to have gone downhill a bit. My red wine was served over chilled, and my steak brought out bloody rare when I asked for medium. The menus which used to be printed on nice cardstock are now flimsy paper inserted into a laminated sleeve - ours were a bit greasy and not clean. Felt more like a chain restaurant. I will say our server Joel was wonderful. But I don't think we'll be coming back

Best happy hour ever! I was in town on business and found this place while looking for something else. Happy hour steak frites at $13....WITH A BEER! Yes, truly wonderful. The prosciutto crostini was delicious and had so much meat, I can't believe it's only $9. I will definitely be back!

Shout out to all my Az peeps ;grab your friends , your dates and your lovers and head on out to Paul Martin's.. This place is 5 stars from beginning to end. For starters you will want to try the Town Dock Calamari, very fresh and lightly battered with delicious chili aioli and house-made cocktail sauce . I had the Chimichurri Chicken . Omg the savory flavors that bust in your mouth is amazing . Hubby had the marinated skirt steak with bourbon glazed sweet potatoes, and dressed arugula . This dish did not disappoint . A must try side dish ...Mac&Cheese Tillamook white cheddar and prosciutto . For dessert we had the seasonal dessert... Lemon creme' Brûlée with homemade cookies it was very light and refreshing . Everything is made from scratch and all their meats and poultry are antibiotic & hormone free . This menu is also Gluten and vegan friendly ! Our waiter Joel was impeccable ,as was all of their waiters and waitresses.  These servers are definitely on their game . The manager Clyde was  very polite and friendly. The atmosphere and the music was kick ass .  We both had cocktails .. Hubby had 2 grapefruit and vodka and I had the same but only one because I am "light weight Lucy"!  The portions are perfect leaving you extremely satisfied . Dress code . Casual nice . Expect to spend around $200.00 for all of that and there is valet parking . My friends do not miss out on this place !!!  As always if you go let me know what you think . Enjoy!

Still 5 stars. They 86'd my smoke chicken and wings which was disappointing but had the salmon lettuce wraps instead. Again, another item that is deadly delicious.   For dinner had the brick chicken and it was perfectly cooked.   Overall, I will be back.

My visit to Paul Martin's was spectacular and exceeded expectations. Though it does kind of look like some other overpriced and stuffy steakhouse establishments, the atmosphere, experience, and quality were top notch.   I came with a large group, and they gave us the banquet room, which was the perfect balance between private and public. They made us feel special from start to finish.   The wine list seemed to please everyone who was into wine. And many of their bottles are actually on cask, so be prepared for your bottle to come without a label. I was more concerned with the beer list, which had anchor steam and hop nosh from uinta. Very impressive for a place like that.   My dinner was a stocked salad with julienned veggies and chicken. A huge serving that could be split between two less hungry people. Others in my group ordered the brick chicken, steak, and some other American standards.   Then came dessert: white chocolate pistachio and chocolate ice cream I believe was house made. Did not disappoint.   Overall a great place to spend an evening being taken care of and eating delicious food.

Overall I would rate this restaurant: 86%.   The layout, decor and ambiance of Paul Martin's are phenomenal. And the complimentary valet is a nice treat.   If you have a large group, I would recommend sitting outside on their patio. They have large couches that make for a comfy dinner space. The servers are very knowledgeable and attentive.   The food overall is a little pricey. The "Brick" chicken is wonderful, but I was not impressed with the Caribbean/jerk chicken.

We decided to try this restaurant on a Sunday night. We were greeted promptly and seated right away in this most attractive restaurant. The decor is most inviting, casual, but, elegant. Our wait-person was friendly and extremely knowledgeable regarding the menu. They bring a small serving of almonds and olives to enjoy with your cocktails. We decided to split the Calamari appetizer. It arrive fresh and perfectly prepared. We ordered the  Chimichurri steak, and the house hamburger plate. Both came perfectly prepared, med-rare, as ordered. Both came with their house fries which were nice and fresh, but, a little too salty. The burger, with cheese was nice and juicy, made with flavorful beef. The bun, very important, was nice. The Chimichurri steak was excellent. Tender and flavorful, and, cooked perfectly. There was no room for desert, but, we did order de-caf coffee, which arrived barely warm. Most disappointing since this is the last thing served. I would definitely return, the entrees were excellent, the service friendly and professional, and, the decor beautiful. P.S.- they offer a daily special, until 7p.m. of a burger, fries and a beer, all for $13.00, a great deal.

Saturday afternoon is a great time to sit down for an amazing meal. The fish & chips were good, and the NY Strip was perfectly cooked, medium rare. But, the desserts were to die for! We will definitely visit again.

Just finished our, I don't know, maybe 15 or more meal at this great establishment. The crab cakes with chunks of crab legs on top was great. My steelhead (freshwater salmon) on cedar plank was excellent. My wife and son had the incredible shrimp with  linguini and cleaned their plates.  You have to have the, unfortunately now smaller, chocolate cake with the highlight brandy cherries for desert. The best part to us is the extremely friendly service.  Thanks gang!!  Kudos yet again

HOLY COW. This place is unbelievably good.  My fiance and I were very impressed.  The service was amazing from the hostess to the server to the manager who stopped by to check in on us.  The food was out of this world.  The spinach dip appetizer is probably the best I've ever had.  The Short Rib is unbeatable.  The Steak Cobb Salad is incredible.  My mouth is literally watering ... this restaurant is not only worth going to, but worth returning to over and over again.  ENJOY!!

I visited Paul Martin's for the first time last night.  I loved the smoked salmon that I had.  It was outstanding, however they served a nice piece of healthy fish with 4 ginormous pieces of bread.  I would have rather had a vegetable or side salad.

I had previously visited the original Paul Martin's in Roseville, California so I was pleased to find that this location is just as good. Everything is prepared on site and the menu changes seasonally. Everything is excellent and prices are reasonable. Service was very attentive and if we had been there in the evening I could see that they had an excellent selection of wine and other beverages. Paul Martin's is an excellent place for a nice meal or to celebrate a special occasion. And although we sat inside, I noticed that they have a very nice patio that would be great to try.

We've been wanting to try this place for a long time, but I knew it was kind of high priced, so it took us a while to get here.  The food was delish and we Loved the atmosphere! Definitely higher priced than I like,  but was worth it... for an every once in a while place.

One word sums up Paul Martin's American Grill: EXCEPTIONAL. If there was every an indicator about the quality of what was to follow, the perfect fried calamari appetizer would be it...and it was perfect in every way, which surely isn't common in my experience. The fried shrimp, grilled artichokes, and antipasto appetizers all echoed the calamari: great quality and perfectly prepared.  As for the main courses, the blackened ribeye was magnificent: perfectly charred on the outside, tender and medium rare on the inside, and impeccably seasoned (I despise the salty bitterness that I've experienced with this dish in so many other restaurants).  Next up was a Chicken under a Brick. All I'm gonna say is this: make sure at least one person in your party orders this dish! I guarantee after all of the ooh's and ahh's you hear coming from that person's direction, you'll be ordering it on your next visit too. It was outstanding.   As for the space itself...contemporary and inviting. The small, semi-private dining area in the rear is where you wanna be if you have a large party.   I read some of the other Yelp reviews, and I recognize that even the best restaurants can screw up a dish on occasion - this one included - particularly when they're pushing things out of the kitchen on a busy night (the place was packed)! But that didn't happen to me. My overall dining experience was exemplary. My only criticism was there wasn't any room in my stomach for dessert. Great job!

***Great Place!*** Three of us sat in the bar at the communal tables, fun upbeat atmosphere with hip music - We were immediately greeted and ordered beverages (homemade lemonade is amazing!).  Our waitperson, Julia, approached us within 2-3 minutes, she was friendly, well dressed and very professional. She offered appetizers, suggesting some of her favorites, we asked several questions and were surprised that Julia not only knew the ingredients in each dish but also where the product came from AND it's all made from scratch! Love it!!    We ordered Salt & Pepper Wild Prawns * Town Dock Calamari * Kale Caesar Salad * Castroville Artichoke * Spinach Dip and ... we CONSUMED IT ALL  ( : Kale Caesar Salad was my personal favorite, exceptional product, white anchovies and the dressing was absolutely perfect. Least favorite was the Grilled Artichoke, mostly because it was just grilled artichoke. Overall, fabulous experience!!  Noticeably good quality product and nothing tasted sugar enhanced... Nice job PMAG - My new favorite place

Ok we had bad service, we specifically asked for the kids meal first and put the order first, while we decide on what we wanted to eat. We didnt bread after we put the kids meal in and had to ask for it. All three of us orderd steaks, but the kids meal came 10 min after the steaks. Apparently chicken tenders take longer to cook. Then we had asked for a side of sweet potato fries all along with our steak, which came like 10 min after the kids meal. The waitress accidently spilled red wine on us. In the end weren't given any compensation or discount. Next time well have to think twice about visiting here again.

What and specifically where am I to eat in the Scottsdale area? Found it here - at the northwest corner of Rose and Scottsdale road! This is the new american cuisine to ease my curiosity of Paul Martin's style and techniques, and to ease my craving palate for different flavors. Oh the joys of summer has shineth upon us.   Our table was ready as expected with a reservation. Beginning beverage was the Raspberry Martini. House made infused raspberry vodka, lemon juice and sweet vermouth. Does indeed pass the sweet drink test! :)   Let's get straight to the food: Cedar Plank Salmon  - From the Classics. comes with shallots and bacon to give the powerful dominating flavors to best complement the cedar notes of the salmon, along with organic bloomsdale spinach, and crimini mushroom jus. This was a nice delicate dish to finish every last bite of.   Marinated Skirt Steak - thinly sliced with a pink center cut for the medium, with hearty mound of spinach on top.    Lemon Meyer Crème brulee - a seasonal dessert. Bits of lemon rinds in the crème brulee and 4 mini slices of lemon on top, and a couple biscuits. This is one of my many favorite desserts. I could just come back for this alone!   A phenomenal place for dinner, drinks and dessert.

This place only got 2 stars from me because they treat people badly based on there clothes. I was there with friends for a causal dinner and felt unwelcome and definitely got treated that way as well. I ordered a hamburger and after it was still not cooked correctly after the 3rd time. I was definitely ready to leave. Management never came over to speak with us or even apologize. But I did see them at other tables laughing and chatting with other customers. People still have yet to learn NOT to judge a book by its cover. I Will never be going back here again.
Came here with family for my Mom's 87th Birthday. The food was amazing and our server (wish I had gotten his name ) was so friendly and really made our celebration a special one!!'

Great food and fabulous servers, John and Paul, two nights in a row. The happy hour menu is extremely reasonable with portions big enough to consider a light dinner. Bistro cosmo tasted great! We also had (over two night) the salmon crostini, American burger, deviled eggs and prosciutto and fog jam crostini. The atmosphere is comfortable and casual.

We had an amazing experience at Paul Martin's so I wanted to share it with the rest of the Scottsdale community. We arrive at 8:00PM without a reservation, not knowing if they were going to be able to seat us right away.. and they did no problem. Our waitress, Heather, was incredible right from the get-go. I have food allergies and she wasn't hesitant or put off by my inquisitions. She was willing to go above and beyond my requests and made me feel special like every other patron. When you have food allergies, most of the time, your options are limited to one or two "safe" things on the menu. Heather was able to offer me alternatives and meet my requests no problem.  FOR THOSE OF YOU WITH GLUTEN ALLERGIES/SENSITIVITIES - they have a SEPARATE fryer for their french fries, which means no cross contamination!! This is epic, considering most restaurants just pile them all in together. I was so excited to be able to get a bunless burger, with the toppings, and sweet potato fries that were super crispy and flavorful. It was one of the best experiences I've had eating out in ages and I can't say enough good things about their waitstaff, their food and their service. HIGHLY recommend!!!

Need a NEW menu that describes what you are serving people!  Butter salad was all field greens with a couple pieces of butter lettuce.  Quinoa and bulgar wheat side dish was mostly arugula with a little quinoa.  Salmon was served dry and overcooked.  I had to cut it with a knife!  Noisy.  Came home hungry!
The atmosphere was really warm and inviting... The food was mediocre at best. I would have expected the food to be amazing, but it just wasn't. Very bland and tasteless. Doubt I'll be back.
From the hostess, Serene, to the server, Steve, and bartender Dustin: Perfection. The banana cream pie is legendary.

Decided to try this nearby eatery and came away quite satisfied. While the food was slow to come out, when it arrived it was satisfying and very tasty. The closer for us was our server. Morgan was incredibly attentive and knowledgeable and made us feel like we were her only table. We will return.

Great tasting coffee. Had Valentine's Day lunch before leaving town. Had a burger and split a mac and cheese with the wife. The fries are fresh cut and never frozen.  Good food, fast service and friendly staff! Will return next time in town!

Great eats. Wait staff awesome which is what is lacking a most places anymore . A little expensive but over all a great experience. I have tried the other restaurants in the area and this is the best.

I would go back if somebody invited me, but I don't think I would ever choose to go here on my own again. I've been here twice now, once for lunch and another time for dinner and I'm really not impressed. I feel like for $30 a plate the flavor a should really be there and each time this place has fallen short. I enjoyed my $7 burger the other day more than I enjoyed my $25 burger tonight. But on the plus side, they have good service and a nice ambiance.
