Walking into Paul Matin's American Grill, you'll immediately notice the awesome decor. We were seated on the patio, which was nice but extremely loud. Besides the noise and a long wait for our drink order, everything was really good. I had the hamburger and I recommend it.

Actually closer to 3.5 stars. The restaurant's menu is as generic as the name. If you don't like seafood or meat - you are certainly not going find much to eat here. The menu is not creative and the dishes are all standard. As far as the food goes...I had a burger and it was excellent - cooked to perfection, which is a plus. When I asked the waiter, he said the meat was organic, but I am suspicious because it wasn't mentioned that way on the menu. The salad that accompanied it was awesome too. My date had the polenta, which was supposed to be served with freshly grated Parmesan cheese,  but wasn't. She also mentioned there wasn't enough sauce served with her dish and had to ask for more. I had a beer, in which I was charged more then what the menu said it cost and she had a glass of wine. For dessert, we split the strawberry shortcake. Yes, it was delicious, but jeez for $10 could they be any more skimpy on the strawberries? There weren't even enough slices to taste one in every bite. It was more like powdered sugar, fresh biscuit and whipped cream with a strawberry garnish. Although they were thinly sliced, I can't imagine there were more than two and half small strawberries served in the dish. The service was very good. Perhaps, my only complaint is that our waiter did not give us enough time to try our meals before he asked how our food was. The manager did briefly stop by our table. I would not go back to this restaurant without another coupon and even then - it wasn't really a great deal. This place is way overpriced. I agree with a previous Yelper that Roaring Fork is much better. I'd also add so is Seasons 52.

Decided to come here after walking out of another place. I'm so glad we stopped here! There are not enough words to describe how amazing this establishment is!  We sat outside,  beautiful lighting,  perfect setting, comfortable lounging chairs and sofas, as well as elegant tables for 4. They select organic produce, free ranged and hormone free proteins,  and they have gluten free options!  Our waitress was amazing! She actually reviewed the menu with us! She let me sample wine before I purchased and she catered to our every need! Even one of the managers came to check on us! This was in celebration of an important event for my mother, and Paul Martin exceeded my expectations! We will most definitely be referring everyone and coming back on a regular basis!!!

After the Manager  called us concerned about our disappointment with our entrees the last time we were in, we decided to give them another try. The service was still top notch. They have great servers.  We shared the Grill Salad and it was great. They have wonderful crispy crust sour dough bread. We loved the smoked salmon appetizer with a nice sauce on the side  We had the Blackened Ribeye and the Brick Chicken with a side of their special Cauliflower. They were both wonderful. For dessert we split the Apple Crisp with vanilla Ice cream.  So glad we tried Paul Martins again! Thanks everyone for a great experience.

I went here for my first time on Saturday December 19th, 2015. It is located in the Old Town Scottsdale area so parking was a little bit poopy. The atmosphere is dark, elegant, yet cuddly, just like I like it! We had reservations so we got sat as soon as we arrived.  The service here was AWESOME. Best service I have had so far. Our server answered any questions we had, offered suggestions on the menu and was very knowledgeable, and checked on us regularly. Then, there were server assistants/runners/bussers/whatever you call them that would come by and take your dirty plate and made sure you had a new clean plate and clean silverware. At one point I remember just barely setting my plate down and someone magically appeared out of no where and removed my dirty dish. WOW! Okay enough about the stellar service. Let's talk food.  We did the whole shebang. I ordered a glass of Educated Guess (Cabernet Sauvignon) and my friend ordered a cocktail (forgot which one). As an appetizer, we tried the Butcher's Board. YAY! Cheese and meat! It was a very neat experience trying the different things on the board. We finished that and out came our entree's. I ordered the Prime New York Steak with a side of mac and cheese. (I'm drooling and I haven't even begun to explain the heavenly flavor). So, my meat came with pt. reyes blue cheese butter. It was delicioso! The mac and cheese was bomb. The meat was EXACTLY how I ordered it: medium. It was so tender and juicy! My friend ordered the blackened ribeye with mac and cheese. He said his was amazing as well. He ordered dessert to go but I didn't try any because I was full. I bet it was amazing, though.  This place is a little bit pricy but it was worth it. Everything was beyond anything I've ever had. When this college kid can save up some more money she will definitely return.

This restaurant is in our neighborhood, and we were anxious to try it for the first time today. Sunday afternoon, around 1:00 pm. We were greeted nicely from the hostess who sat us outside, per our request. At least 10 minutes later, after no one had come to greet us, much less ask for our drink order or ask if we had any questions about the menu, so we left. We eat out every single Sunday, we probably won't be back to Paul's.

We love Paul Martin's American Grill. The salmon grilled on a cedar plank is fabulous, and the short ribs are killer.  They have a wonderful deal on Monday nights (called Monday night wine dinner) and you get two organic salads, two entrees (any entree on the menu) and a bottle of wine (good selection) for $49!!  In addition, their Happy Hour is wonderful!  The staff is cordial and friendly (we like that in Scottsdale) AND they use local ingredients where they can.  What's not to love?

We made reservations for 11 this week for dinner.  Everyone was so accommodating and patient.  The drinks never emptied and the service was awesome.  We had the all the appetizers but the yummy bread was the best!  Calamari was ever so salty and fresh!  I had the skirt steak and it was cooked to perfection.  Juicy and tasty.  The lemon creme brulee was out of this world  The group loved the banana creme pie.    No negatives to report.  All the things!

Grabbed a seat at the bar and decided to check out the happy hour menu.  Bartender knew exactly how to help me when I was deciding on the salmon.  Ordered the house salmon which comes with baguettes and creme fresh.  Excellent piece of salmon and the baguette was toasted just right.  Great dish overall.  The fiancée ordered the shredded beef tacos and no complaints for the $5.00 price.  It didn't wow me, but for $5.00 to enjoy some tender beef with a good sauce, you can't complain at all.  Lastly they we're talking my language.  A burger, fries and beer combo.  Burger is fresh ground in house and you can tell.  Ordered medium rare, and came out perfect temperature.  Toasted ciabatta bun and black pepper aioli.  Fries were  good but the hand crafted beer selection is even better :)   So to top it all off, the famous and home made banana cream pie.  Won't say much except you have to order it.....okay I will say it was damn good!!!  Actually all their desserts are made in house, so I have a feeling no matter what you order you won't be disappointed   Service, quality and value 100%. Absolutely will be back
We stopped in for dinner, and had an amazing experience with Carl as our server. Not only was the service exceptional, the food was amazing. Try the prime rib!

Steakhouse cobb salad here was superb. Service at the bar was spot on. Scotch choices were limited and very expensive - having 2 drinks with my salad put me at an $80 tab. Less expensive than flemings across the street, with comparable food, but still.....
Anna was our server and she was hands down amazing. We were visiting from Chicago and she made me feel at home here.... great customer service.

Great place . Monday special with salads entree choices and choice of several bottles of wine a great deal at $50 . Tuesday night fried chicken dinner at $20 also. Friendly efficient service. We will be back next time in Arizona for sure!

I went here New Years Eve 12/31/17  There was a lot of parking outside in the entry area  I thought that when I walked in with my party of 4 there was going to be a little bit of a wait but NO we walked right in to a nice table close to the bar!!   There was a good amount of waiters and waitresses!! It being New Years night there were less than I expected!  We ordered our drinks pretty quickly!! Once the waiter brought us our drinks he did not come back for a god 7-9 minutes!! We kind of wanted to hurry our dinner up because it was late and a long day!!   When he came to take our order the food came out pretty quickly!!   AMAZING RIBS AND MASHED POTATOES!!!    After all this a great family place to eat!!   We had to wait along time for the check and when we had it ready to pay it took awhile for him to get it!   9.5/10  - 0.25 for the long wait between drinks and ordering  - 0.25 for slow check return

I personally think this is one of the better happy hours in the valley food wise. We tried the the steak frites with a drink for $13 bucks. Also the hamburger with tillamook cheese + drink also for $13 dollars. The quality and flavor is superb. The complimentary bread and butter is amazing! Their Mac and cheese side is pricey but well worth it. In this visit I also ordered the avocado tacos on the happy hour menu and we all enjoyed them. Will be back again! Shout out to our server Courtney. He was great!

Wow. Just amazing. We drove by the restaurant and decided to have dinner here. The food is excellent. I ordered the skirt steak and my boyfriend got the house special of friend chicken, corn and red potato salad. We also ordered a bottle of Hangtime (Pinot Noir) which was well chilled.   The atmosphere and decor is top notch. Very relaxed and well decorated. The wait staff is attentive. Picking up plates when appropriate and refilling glasses when needed. They are also very knowledgeable.   The GM stopping by is also to enquirer about our dinner was a welcoming experience.   I would recommend this place 100%. We will be coming back and also look forward to it!
Our first time here! Very relaxing and service was excellent! James and the manager took care of us! We enjoyed the food.
We love to come to Paul Martin. The service is always exceptional, the food sumptuous and the ambiance romantique.
Quality food with excellent service consistently.  Try the burger or the salt and pepper shrimp both delicious.

The restaurant is beautiful. The service great. The food was not great. My fish tacos consisted of a nice piece of mahi mahi covered with and I mean covered with sautéed stringed red onion and long pieces of parsley. The short ribs serving was very small and ok glaze-wise. The pasta dish was nice. For the price, nothing to rave about. If plain food that looks fancy is your thing then this place is for you.

Paul Martin's was a great experience for me. The place is very airy and semi-bright. I love the style/decor throughout.   Staff were all pleasant and adorned with smiles. The manager addressed the table a couple of times, when is always a nice gesture.   I had the pork chop, which was phenomenal! After a couple of bites, I was sold on the salmon too! The banana creme pie was not worth all the hype. The bananas were brown and very mushy...not what I'm accustomed to. But all and all, Paul Martin's is a great place for a first date, to catch up with friends, or to unwind with your significant other. It tends to get pretty busy, so make reservations!

We had a good lunch. The difference between 4 and 5 stars was primarily the cost for a simple lunch with wine. I think it is a bit expensive for the selection and particularly the wines. The cheapest attractive entrees were $11 and the cheapest red wine was $9 (I bought a good wine for $10.)  I had tacos and they were good. Friend had burger and cheapest alternative was $13 but he says it was good. Both had salad which was good but on a hot plate. Excellent wine list by the glass though expensive. Beer list interesting but I didn't check prices. Good waiter and good assistants

Ordered the eggs Benedict, which arrived cold after over a 30 minute wait. The potatoes that came with it were mediocre. Fruit plate and bread that came before the meal were very good, overall I was not impressed

Atmosphere: casual dress code with a nice ambiance.   Service: Awesome, water glass was always full and our food came out timely. Our server was knowledgable. Every employee we talked to was very polite and courteous.   Bread & Apps: Home made freshly baked bread. Fluffy and delicious. We got the calamari and some oysters. Everything was awesome.  Dinner: I had the ribeye she had the chicken. Steak was cooked perfectly and seasoned deliciously. She loved the chicken. Both were served with mashed potatoes which were damn good.   Too full for sweets. Although they do have some home made ice cream which was tempting.   Everything here is cooked fresh daily. None of the sauces are pre made. You really can taste the difference. The price was also very fair. I've paid more for similar meals. With everything above including a glass of 12 yr scotch and a glass of wine our total was $120 + tip.   I definitely recommend checking them out.

Came here for lunch on a weekday, the first week they opened. I can understand that there are always kinks to iron out at a new opening but my experience was just blah. Not good, not bad.. I was with an elderly companion.  After being greeted at the front door the first question from the host/manager was do you have a reservation?  Not, how are you or how is your day going. (No, we don't have a reservation, its 11 am on a wednesday and you've been open 3 days..) We were then asked if we prefer inside or outside. I told them that my friend doesn't like drafty patios much so inside would be best. We were then brought to a table right next to the open screen of that drafty patio. While I thought it looked like a lovely enclosed patio with citrus trees and cute lights, that table was obviously not going to work.  After getting settled into a setback booth the awkward service,  or over - servicing rather, started. I think it was his first serving job so I can cut him a little slack, he was very kind and definitely friendly, just so so awkward. I don't understand it when servers announce their actions. (I will go get your iced teas and be right back with them, I will put your spinach dip in and be back to answer any questions, I'm going to take your plate if you're finished, I see you didn't use your silverware for your appetizers so I dont need to give you new ones..) its idle chatter, sounds unprofessional,  and is so unnecessary.  I know you're coming back with stuff I order...that's why I am here. Service should be unobtrusive at a place like what they're going for, you shouldn't interrupt your diners conversation to complete a list of service points you have to hit. They have a lot of fine tuning to do.  Another awkward thing was the staff that werent waiting on tables all standing around against the walls and watching service. I'm not sure if they were managers, corporate guys, or servers as they were all dressed nice. But the staring was uncomfortable..at least smile while you're watching. And you just opened, I'm sure there's something to do somewhere.  Oh yeah...the food! Nothing to write home about. Nothing stood out on the menu as different than any of the other upscale american grills in the area. They do use all local purveyors and boast a scratch kitchen, which is always a nice touch. I guess I was expecting some new and exciting can't get everywhere menu items to go with that.

Very disappointing.  My kale Caesar had way too many anchovies for my taste.  Changed the whole make up of the salad.  My wife had the bbq pork ribs.  So fat.  And she subbed the French fries for a sweet potato.  It was actually a potato with sugar and the server argued it was an  organic sweet potato.  What a joke.  I would never come back

Happy hour is only in the bar but they do not make that clear when they are seating you. The experience was nice, very cute ambience but really just mediocre food. Probably would only go back for the homemade ice cream.

Have had the pleasure of dining here several times & felt it was time for a review. Food today was great. Their mushroom soup is rich & delicious. My friend ordered the mushroom burger (vegetarian & comprised of several varieties of mushrooms). She was kind enough to share & I must say it was the best vegetarian burger I've ever had. Another friend was celebrating a birthday & the restaurant was kind enough to bring a complimentary dessert. Wish I knew the name as it was extraordinary ~ chocolate bottom with peanut butter, ice cream & topped with a roasted marshmallow. I would return just for the dessert.   Our server, Trent, was excellent as was the manager who made sure we were enjoying our lunch. Great food, great service & a beautiful environment.

A little slow getting service to the table but after that, smooth sailing. Delicious food, delightful server and great ambiance! We had the Marinated skirt steak (medium rare) and it was cooked perfectly! The grilled sweet potatoes were delicious!

Honestly surprised this place has received a bunch of 5ers...  They've redone the old J. Alexanders - the patio is spacious and airy and today at least [it's still spring...] had blooming orange trees so the atmosphere was really pleasant. We sat at one of the sofa/table combos and it was comfy and not at all awkward to eat. Decent crowd, nice hum and could have our own conversation unimpeded by surroundings. Boom. We were firing on all cylinders. Until the food.   Service was prompt and attentive but not hovering. BP [biz partner] had the Asian Chopped and our server Dustin suggested the Greek Salad with Lemon Prawns [I was wavering between that and the Grilled Salmon Sandwich.] We both had iced tea - crisp, unsweetened, fine. Our salads came out and I was jealous. The Asian looked more appetizing than mine - better presentation and overall just looked more appetizing. Mine had whole butter lettuce [I mean, okay, but really? It's a salad. Why do I need to cut my lettuce, peeps?] Two different kinds of olives - which, if I really was an olive fan would have been great because there was very little else of substance. There was a nice amount of feta, way way waaaay too many tomatoes and I'm sorry, THREE prawns. Three. They tasted good but for $16, I would've had more protein if I'd ordered the sandwich. It just isn't a good value nor that great.  [$40 before tip for two salads and iced tea.]   It's just a 'meh' from me - even the outstanding patio space doesn't save it.

Lovely lunch on the patio. Nice place to visit with friends. A bit European - that is they allowed to visit and kept our coffee hot without any hint of "turn the tables". As usual the food was very good but not to die for. Just an enjoyable experience that was made better by our waiter John.

For us, Paul Martin's has turn into a familiar, home away from home.   Over the last four months, we have been here four times. The food is delicious and creatively prepared. We haven't had a bad meal or dish yet.   If UR into Happy Hour, theirs lasts until seven, this is a must try. They have some incredibly tasty items for $6 (see photos), like Street Tacos, panko breaded Tater Tots and Deviled Eggs. For $9 (photos), you'll be in heaven over their Maple Glazed Chicken Skewers or St Louis Duroc Pork Ribs.   Their HH Cocktails are $6 to $9 and their wines by the glass ($6, $9 and $14) have some real depth. Gotta love their 7 oz. Williamette Valley Pinot for $14. Try it, you'll see I'm right. It's a great pour, nice bouquet, and has a sophisticate mix of berry tastes.   Their dinners are equally great, whether UR here on Sunday for their Three Course $34 Prime Rib Special, or a week night, or even a Sunday Brunch - you won't be disappointed.   I could write more about their food, but I'll let my nearly forty photos speak for themselves. Expect to pay around $40 to $50 for a great value, tasty meal that you won't soon forget and cannot wait to come back to Paul Martin's for more.  One last thing, if you can, ask to be seated in James' section.  All the servers here are really great, but he is exceptional. He remembers your likes and finds a way to make your visit memorable.   Enjoy!

A truly excellent experience all-around.  This Scottsdale outpost of the upscale chain features soft lighting, a jazzy soundtrack, and phenomenal food and service.  A complimentary dish of local olives and almonds kicks off the meal, with a small, locally-sourced menu heavy on beef (with several chicken and fish options as well). No matter your choice, you will not be disappointed.  I ordered the skirt steak, the slices of marinated beef cooked to a perfect medium rare and accented by the bright flavor of fresh arugula and meaty heirloom tomatoes. A wine list contained some formidable selections, with a few craft beers added in. Just as a fine cabernet sauvignon can compliment a steak, so can a bottle of North Coast Old Rasputin imperial stout.  Dessert selections were just as well-prepared and ranged from an assortment of house-made ice creams, a banana cream pie, and a decadently rich devil's food cake.  While not flawless (the bread, much touted by the wait staff, arrived lukewarm and with just a dab of butter), it is as good a dining experience as you will find in Scottsdale.

We had reservations for dinner, but decided to swing by the bar first to take advantage of the amazing happy hour.  I ordered a delicious raspberry martini and thoroughly enjoyed it.  We were seated and really enjoyed the classy, comfortable atmosphere.  I ordered the blackened redfish with spinach and lemon - so light and good!  Fantastic service too...coming in on Halloween night was a great idea as the restaurant was really slow.

There's something to be said about consistency. Paul Martin's will never stray so I'm a big fan immediately. I love that this is in my neighborhood so it's almost like me cooking at home. Reservations are suggested but I've always been able to slip in and enjoy the friendly staff and yummy food. If you can snag a seat on the patio, even better especially during this beautiful weather. It's cozy and perfect ambiance to canoodle.  As recommended and tipped by fellow foodies, I highly recommend the Raspberry Martini. I probably would have imbibed on the great selections of drinks but only more reason to return since happy hour lasts til 7p. I loved the calamari as a teaser to start. And the kale Ceasar is pretty filling especially when you add salmon or chicken. I have to say I swooned over the niman Pork Chop which is major kudos given I always choose steak. I think it takes finesse to cook pork to be juicy and tender; hence, I didn't share though the portion was so big I had leftovers. The brussel sprouts were perfect accompaniment to the entree. Who refuses mac'n'cheese should never sit at my table! The highlight for me is truly the staff. They have such an ease and joyful smiles that you want to stay til close. I thought it was kind they didn't rush us out despite past closing time. I have no problem ending my day here and so should you.

We were in Scottsdale for business/vacation and were looking for a restaurant with gluten free options.  Although it was a weeknight we luckily had made reservations as the place was packed.  Our server was great; tolerant and patient with our questions.  My husband was worried that the short rib would be dry (it wasn't) and I was worried that the filet would be over cooked (I said it needed to be "mooing ").  All of the food came exactly as we ordered and in a timely manner.  Even the side (spinach) was flavorful and not over-cooked.

Upscale American bar and grill scene right in Scottsdale. Came with a group of friends on a Friday night and for good reason place was packed. We decided to start off with the Calamari which was prepared  Rhode Island's style which was lightly breaded with a chili aioli and a house cocktail sauce and also the salt and pepper shrimp cocktail. The shrimp cocktail was prepared perfectly which on the menu said lightly fried which you couldn't tell. Was not overly impressed with the sauce that came with the calamari. For my meal I decided on the on the brick chicken dish which came with mashed potatoes, Za'atar croutons, herb jus chicken dish which came with very juicy and sauce was even better. Other people in my group decided on the French dip with fries and the fries were regular string cut but a little bit well done and were great. Other people in the group decided on the filet which was the most tender well prepared meal of the group. This would be my suggestion if you decided to venture here in the future definitely try the filet..
The happy hour was disappointing.  The food was sub standard at best.  Too bad, great ambiance.

What a pretty place for a lunch with the girls! We had a beautiful and delicious crudités platter and it is perfectly fresh and tasty. Heirloom carrots and yellow and green beans and tiny sweet tomatoes and more. The green goddess dressing is flavorful. We had the poblano chile relleno and  I almost had to 'had to' lick the plate. Tasty! Our friend who is vegetarian found lots of choices to her liking. Lots of great eats....surely will be back for dinner and drinks!

Food not our style  It was several months ago we were here, just now getting around to posting this.   Food was not our style. A very good piece of salmon. And ruined it by smothering it in onions and spinach. I thought the spinach and onions were going to be a side dish. If salmon is farm raised or Atlantic then it does need extra work to get a good flavor, but WA or AK fish is outstanding with just a bit salt and pepper, cedar plank or fresh lemon. It does not need a lot to have excellent flavor.

Came here for dinner with a friend Friday. We made reservations so we were taken back right away. Our server was in training but he did an excellent job, more of the reason why I give it 4 stars is because the service was prompt and server kept us very well informed and knowledgable about the menu. Love also that everything is made from scratch and in house.   We started our night of with a glass of wine each, I was very impressed with their wine list and also how their selection of by the glass was quite extensive than most steak houses. We had the seafood platter as our appetizer. Came with fresh oysters, shrimp, lobster, and a salmon spread lettuce wrap. Very tasty, however the portions were VERY small for the price you are paying. I had the cedar plank salmon as my meal, it was good but could have been better. The sauce was very runny which made the presentation look very sloppy and salmon could have been cooked better. My friend had the rib eye steak, it looked amazing and friend said it was tasty. Had a piece of the broccolini it had as a side and loved it.  For desert we tried the raspberry crem brûlée and it may have been my favorite part of the meal. Cooked perfectly and moist.   With 2 glasses of wine later and a $200 tab we would say we enjoyed our dinner. Food would review as 3-3.5 but gave it 4 stars because of the ambiance of the place and great service.

Plus being an exceptional experience it was ALSO how effortless they did all the right things. Great food, great service and exceptional attention by the Manager! From walking in to leaving, embracing all the best of hospitality. Happy to be residents of beautiful Az. & Co..

We had a great experience going here for our anniversary. The food was amazing!  We ordered the shrimp, fish tacos, and spare ribs. All were fabulous. Plus the servers were very attentive and kind. We would definitely go back!
REALLY loved our evening at Paul Martins!  Thank you for a great time ~ best food & best service!  Seriously, as good as it gets.

Went here while in town on business. We originally had plans to go to a restaurant next door but there was an hour wait so we tried Paul Martin's and were seated immediately. Server was very friendly and attentive and answered our questions about certain menu items and told us what his favorites were. Bread and appetizers came out pretty quick by we did have to wait a little longer for our entree's. Both the sever and manager kept checking on us though and were very apologetic. When the food did come, it was very good. I got the brick chicken which I definitely recommend. Very good experience and would recommend to others.
Katherine was our Server and she was wonderful.   And the Happy Hour Menu is sooooo worth it.  Mushroom veggie burger with fries, and a beer for $13.00. Delicious.

I was between a four and five star review about #PaulMartins however the gracious service of the manager, Clyde swayed me towards a five star review.  Our meal was fabulous, the waiters were knowledgeable of their way variety menu and offered prompt service.  We began on dinner by ordering a bottle of their Cabinet listed on their Happy Hour menu. The wine was fabulous but I forget the name of the wine. I like wine but I nowhere near a wine expert.  After the wine was opened we order a dozen of the mixed oysters. The oysters were received with mixed review. Some types of oysters were definitely found more tasty than others.  I enjoyed a delicious bowl of mushroom soup. I love mushrooms and my bowl of soup did not disappoint- bravo to the chef for this delightful starter.  My husband and sister both were happy were their choice of salads.  My entree was a mouth watering generous portion of tasty ribeye surround by creamy mash potatoes. An entree of fresh salmon was inhaled by my husband and my sister took delight in each bite of her New York Steak. The New York Steak was served with favorable cauliflower. We finished our meal with three bailey's coffees and several desserts. I am usually not a big fan of ice cream for dessert but the sea salt caramel ice cream lingered with favor.  The meal came to a close and the bill arrived.  It was a pricey meal. However, every higher end restaurant is expensive. We all agreed the fabulous dinner was well worth the price. We will be back.  As a side note, the restaurant had a terrific vibe and good energy.

We had very overpriced salads for lunch, which were pretty flavorless and sparse with the ingredients they were supposed to have. Asian salad was bland & chicken was dry. Had to ask for more dressing. Not worth $19. Shrimp & Butter lettuce salad was bland, shrimp was good. Only a morsel of blue cheese and pecans in salad. Not worth $20 2 Redfish tacos were good, but again not worth the  price and came with no sides.  House ice tea was good. Wait staff was average. Atmosphere was wonderful on the patio. Will not return or recommend. Cheers

Great service (Thomas was excellent). Very friendly and informative.   Love the bar set up. Ladies you can hang your purse and charge your phone!  Great daily happy hour menu with awesome hours 3pm-8pm.   Now the food... Great happy hour bites at a great price with no sacrifice of quality or taste! I'm sure the rest of the menu will not disappoint. Seasonal menu. Fresh ingredients. Love love love!   Just hoping Paul Miller brings this restaurant to the East!!!

The happy hour has a great menu at a fair price. The service was great as well. The only thing that I was a bit disappointed in was that the happy hour is only in the bar area and the bar is very small with a few 4 seat high tables and two community tables. I have never really been a fan of the community tables. But overall the experience was great and the food was yummy.

The Brussel sprouts were so horrible I returned them after one bite. It was still on my bill when I got the bill. Trying to order was an ordeal. I explained to the waitress that I was vegan and would like the pasta. I asked them to make the pesto for me without the cheese which is very easy to do. She said they could not because they make it in big batches. This really means they do not make it at all. It is ordered pre-made. I asked what other sauce is available. She said they could add a butter sauce. I asked if they use a vegan butter. She said no. I asked about the Brussel sprouts. She explained everything on them including bacon as though that was a vegan product. I told I do not eat bacon. She said it could be made without bacon. I had to eat sweet potato fries for dinner because I did not want a salad and the Brussel sprouts were horrendous.

I had a really weird, really busy day. When I have such a day (it happens at least twice a week) I want someone else to cook for me. And I want a drink. So, I pass Paul Martin's twice a day. Last night I was starving and so many places close at 9. Paul was open till 10. Side note - I went to Taphouse Kitchen which states online that they are open till 10, but upon walking in at 8:40, I was informed in an unfriendly way by the bartender that the kitchen was closed. I am a bartender / server on weekends so I get the sense of a shitty attitude right off the bat. Can I do two reviews at once? Anyway... I walk in to Paul Martin's, was greeted immediately, went to sit at the bar. I am a vegan and can usually find something to eat at restaurants. Robert was behind the bar this particular evening and he assured that my needs were met, and he was also very pleasant to talk to. I felt bad because he had a couple come in at 9:57 and order a bottle of wine. They close at 10. No idea how long he was there. Great service. Great food. Had the grilled artichoke and quinoa bowl. Thanks, Robert. Will be back.

Went there for lunch. A little too pricey. $88.00 FOR 2, no alcohol. Had the halibut $30.00 it was good, but not delicious. Shared the crab cake appetizer $16.00 FOR 1 crab cake. (That was good but over priced.)
Staff is very friendly and professional. However, the food is way too rich. My brother and I both felt sick afterwards and we ordered different items on the menu.

Will not return to this restaurant.  Food is a big disappointment and management is overbearing and pushy. We waited over 30 minutes for food.  When we sat down 6 olives and some almonds were placed on table for 8 people.  After we ordered meals 6 slices of bread were delivered.   Mushroom  soup served cold, French Dip is ok (better in New River) and Prime Rib is fatty with a pile of mashed potatoes.  The best was the salad, but it only had several varies of lettuce in it, but dressing was good.   Can find good salads in many other places close by,  will not recommend to friends.  Prices are on the high side even for Scottsdale.  Waiter was best part.  He knew the dishes and was attentive to needs.   He deserves a 4 or 5 for his service and the handicap he works with the quality and management.

Paul Martin's has a lot going for it - too bad the stuff on the periphery was bad.   Paul Martin's is a nice and rather classy steakhouse that definitely reminds me of D.C. steakhouses. The lighting is dark but pleasant, the music energetic but quiet, and the ambiance rather pleasant.   The food is also good. I had the Sunday special offering, which is salad, prime rib, and ice cream for $25. The salad was good and had a decent flavor palette without being overwhelming.  The prime rib was tender and had an amazing spice rub that took it to the next level, but the interior was something of a vast wasteland of okay meat. The desert didn't happen for me - they had no options for lactose intolerant patrons, which was rather disappointing (and perplexing, given the upper echelons this place places itself in).   The service was rather poor. The server was clearly overwhelmed at times - at one point, he responded to our lactose intolerance inquiry by telling us that the ice cream was gluten free. It actually became rather offensive when we were made to feel guilty about using one of their gift cards - I have no idea why a steakhouse would make paying customers feel so awkward about using a gift card they sold!  Long story short, the food here is four stars, the service two. Three seems appropriate.

This place looks much better from the outside than inside.  I expected more both from the food and experience.  I ordered the Alaskan halibut and it just tasted very flaky and bland. Much better at other places. Glad I gave this place a try, but I won't be coming back.

In from Payson for the night. Heather was our server and she was awesome! She gave great recommendations on our wine and food. Very nice atmosphere. Enjoyed our time away from home. Food was very good and reasonably priced. Will visit again!
WOW!! Great food, great service,  it needs no more words. Go try it and save me a spot at the community table in the bar.

Took my family here for lunch on Valentine's Day. Was pleasantly surprised. Was told right up front that everything is made from scratch. We recently moved to Arizona from San Francisco where 'made from scratch' is the standard - so this made us happy. The food, service, cocktails, atmosphere was excellent. We had our boys (1 and 2 1/2 year olds) with us and felt welcomed. I really enjoyed our lunch and wouldn't hesitate to visit again.

Here is a place that the food and service is always on point. Come for the Burger beer combo for happy hour, the burger was awesome. Not your traditional slider on most happy hour menus. Our server this last time was very attentive and even brought us hot towels after our meals. Great job!!

I don't understand what all the hype is about with Paul Martin's...I'd like to give it 2.5 stars, but rather than round up, I'm rounding down. Looking beyond the really nice decor and well done interior remodel of the restaurant formerly known as J. Alexander's, everything else seemed very lack luster.  I made a call to get a group of three on the waiting list on a Friday night, and the hostess almost seemed confused at my request. When we arrived, we were told that the hostess only had marked us down for a group of two...alright, no big deal, an honest mistake I guess. There was about a 20 minute wait so we decided to get some drinks at the bar. It was pretty crowded, but the bartender was fairly dismissive and not overly friendly upon our arrival, just a quick delivery of the menu and "what will you be drinking?"..hmm okay.  When we got the text message that our table was ready, the same absent minded hostess sat us, and only brought two menus. I'm not sure what the deal was, but we clearly had a party of three, c'mon now! When our server arrived, he was kind enough to offer a smile and a proper greeting. We ordered the bruschetta appetizer right away and had our drink order placed. When he came back over, he spieled the specials for the night - and REALLY emphasized the new bruschetta, which we had already ordered. At this point, the series of service miscues were almost laughable to us and we figured we were already there so let's just roll with the punches.  Entrees came out, and my girlfriend had the steak cobb salad which was good, her mom had the polenta which was fine, and I had the New York French Dip which is their "twist" on a prime rib shaved sandwich. It instead has shaved New York strip on it and I must say, I was completely underwhelmed by the flavor of the sandwich - just bland, bland, bland.  Honestly, I know I'm ranting and raving in this review, but it was a totally mediocre experience. It is amazing what a remodel can do to a restaurant, as it was pretty full and seemed more lively than when J. Alexander's was the occupant, but I don't think the food is any better - in my opinion, its not even as good and the service is definitely not up to par.   Maybe I'll give Paul Martin's a second chance, but I'll keep my regularity and loyalty to Houston's and Hillstone for my All-American cuisine fix.

We had dinner here this evening.  We had an enjoyable time.  I like the restaurant decor, hip and modern but unpretentious.  They give you tasty bread and butter to start.  Entrees were good but pricey for the portion size.  My husband had the Marinated Skirt Steak which he said was delicious.  I had read the Brick Chicken was amazing so I ordered it (and I never order chicken when dining out).  Honestly it was just 'ok' and when it arrived I wished I'd have ordered something different.  I could very easily make this at home and the skin on the chicken didn't taste very good.  Kind of disappointing.  But I'm glad we tried the place out.  I'm hoping to return to try their prime rib special for a little better deal.

The service is always top notch and the food is even better. I love going for happy hour with friends to get a burger, fries, and a beer for $13! They're full portions and a full sized beer too. The food is always outstanding and after talking to the waitress about their food I found out that everything is fresh and made in house. The only freezer they have is for the ice cream that they made!  Besides the burger I also highly recommend the street tacos and everything on their dessert menus is absolutely delicious.
I hope the food is delicious, but waiting now 1 hour for a French Dip, Pork Chop and Short Ribs is insanely too long! Seated at 7:30pm, ordered at 7:40pm it's now 8:46pm

In Scottsdale from New York City for business. Great restaurant!  5-7pm happy hour special ($13) gets you a bacon cheeseburger with fries and a tall handcrafted beer. Nice deal! Big portions, nice simple flavors. Perfectly cooked. Homemade mayo was a nice touch.  What brought me here is that everything is made from scratch and they work with local farms and businesses. Their meat is also humanely raised. You can taste and feel the difference. America needs more places like this and we need to support them.

Brunch here is great! The champagne lemonade is a must. For $16 you get fresh fruit (fresh berries and pineapple) blueberry bread with honey butter, a cocktail and a breakfast entree. The staff is friendly and the food is delicious. They have different chef specials during the beginning of the week. I will be back.

I was quite impressed with the service, but the food put me over the top! Everything at this restaurant is all natural, made at the restaurant. Nothing is frozen and you can tell, the food was phenomenal, I will definitely be back!
Eric & Kathy best service & great time! I will be back for sure! Monday's the bomb!! Food was so amazing!!! Blazed chicken, short ribs YUM!!!
The quinoa salad rocked- added steak, which really added texture. Loved the flank skirt, tender, cooked perfectly. Great evening!!

I wish I could give 3.5 stars, because I am torn.  Paul Martin's is just "okay."  The atmosphere and servers/service are great.  However, the food is nothing to write home about.  The selection is rather small, and the price was a little high for what we ate.  They also made some odd choices, like the fish tacos are salmon instead of the usual white fish.  The portions are a good size, and the French fries and mushroom soup were good.  I might try this place again one day, just to see if I can get a truly "4-star" experience.

I really love when Valley restaurants change up their menu based on what ingredients are in season, which is why I love Paul Martin's American Grill's new fall/winter menu, available through March, featuring really tasty items. I tried some really delicious dishes on a recent happy hour visit to the restaurant, which, like I discovered on my first lunchtime visit to the restaurant, I love for its relaxed yet classy atmosphere and exceptional service.  The restaurant uses local produce in its dishes, which made eating vegetarian items like the Castroville Artichoke with pesto aioli ($13) and Wild Museum Soup ($9) so enjoyable.  Eating a large artichoke is always a little hard to handle, but it's also a lot of fun, especially when it's tasty and mesquite-grilled like this one. It was a really great vegetarian option that was perfect for two people, and I loved the smoky qualities of the dish.  The mushroom soup was so delicious, with six types of wild mushrooms, including white shimeji, brown shimeji, maitake and king trumpets. Every bite was a mouth full of mushrooms, which I loved, and this was a thick, hearty soup I would definitely recommend.  The new cocktails (all $12) that accompanied the meals were also delicious. My friend and I loved the Makers Mark Manhattan, with Makers Mark whisky and sweet vermouth and garnished with a Luxardo cherry. It was strong and sweet and had a great holiday spice.  The Ketel One Moscow Mule is also always a great choice, as is the Meyer Lemon Drop, made with house-infused Meyer lemon vodka.  We had to try the delicious new Apple Cinnamon Crisp ($10), which came topped with vanilla ice cream that made every warm bite a perfect holiday dessert.  Other new menu items include Linguine and Shrimp ($23) and Blackened Pacific Redfish ($21 for dinner).  Paul Martin's will have a holiday menu through January 3, as well, including Chilled Alaskan King Crab Legs ($25), Grilled Lamb Sirloin and Herb Crusted Filet Mignon ($39).

There's nothing not to love about Paul Martins. The food is unbelievable. You can Taste the quality of the fresh produce and high quality meat that they serve, they deff don't scrimp on any ingredients. The customers service is always consistent and outstanding. And their specials that they have are such a great deal, seriously can't beat PM. I have been here for both dinner and brunch and its exceptional, my favorite place to eat in the Valley.

If every restaurant could take a lesson from Paul Martin's on how to perfect the quality of food and customer service, bad Yelp reviews wouldn't exist. I am writing this review on a full stomach of delicious cuisine, but it was more than just good food. It was the excellent experience in general.   First off, they accept reservations which is a huge plus during the busy season. We made a reservation and upon arrival, we were seated right away. From the moment we sat down until the moment we left, it was a pleasant experience. Our waiter Jeremy is 50% responsible for the great experience. He greeted us as if we were personal VIP guests of Paul Martin's American Grill (which we were not, just random customers). He was incredibly knowledgeable and educated us on the brand, food and history of Paul Martin's. I had no idea this restaurant is a concept of and owned by Mr. Fleming of Fleming's Steakhouse. All of their food is made in-house from scratch and much of it is sourced locally form Arizona. I gained so much knowledge in such a short period of time, without ever feeling like I was being talked at. It was just friendly conversation by Jeremy who is truly passionate about Paul Martin's and it shows.   Jeremy pointed us in the right direction with everything we ordered and I'm glad we took his advice! We started with the calamari which is not your average rubbery calamari. No, this is cod calamari and it seriously puts any other calamari to shame. The seasonings and freshness of the dish made it taste so good I didn't want the dish to end. We almost didn't get it at first because we figured it would just be like every other calamari we had, but we were definitely wrong.   For dinner, I had the short ribs and mashed potatoes, thanks to Jeremy's suggestion. The meat was tender, juicy and flavorful with each and every bite. The mashed potatoes were just as amazing as the short ribs themselves. For dessert, I gobbled up several bites of the pear and huckleberry cobbler which was delectable to the core and topped with their homemade ice cream.   Between the combination of excellent service from Jeremy and delicious food from Paul Martin's, I'd say this was one of the best dining experiences I've had in awhile. I just wish we had given this restaurant a try much earlier! Now we will definitely find our way back again soon.   PS   - They offer brunch on the weekend for just $14 for a pre-fixe menu. I can't wait to try it!

Happy hour is amazing. Selections for all budgets. Try the $6 lemon drop, it was my favorite. All the food we ordered multiple apps, entres, desserts, drink, etc were everything and beyond what we hoped for. All the staff were very helpful and checked on our table multiple times throughout the night. Will definitely return on every trip to Scottsdale.

Decided to stop in for dinner after my customer event and sat at the bar for dinner.  place was lively and inviting and service was good at the bar.  I started with a Manhattan that was made very well, and then had the steak cobb salad which was excellent and reasonably priced for the quality and quantity.   definitely would recommend this spot.

Awesome food. Great haPpy hour prices, and the oysters were heavenly. We had chicken wings and ribs. Generous pour on the wine and delicious beer. Hannah was a friendly, attentive server. Dessert was a delicious chocolate cake.

Family dinner. Shared Fried Calamari: very good. But salt & pepper shrimps were really good. I had Brick Chicken: very very good. My son had Braised rib and my  wife Chumicurri Chicken. Dinner was great.

Service was exceptional,  and everyone in the restaurant was very friendly.  I had the Cedar Plank Steelhead and grilled cauliflower,  which I highly recommend. The calamari was cooked perfect,  but the sauces were a bit spicy.

This place is Good for a light dinner and cocktails,  They do NOT have a kids menu but a few good options for the little ones are the Mac N Cheese my 7yr old son rated it a 6-7 the cheese burger is a good option as well.  I ordered a few oysters $3 each so why not right they were D lish !  my son had a Shirley temple which he did not care for I guess they make their own grenadine in house but he wasn't impressed and honestly neither was I, it was sour not sweet had an orange flavor rather than a cherry flavor.    We ordered a Cheese burger with side salad, OMG the Ranch is the Bomb.com!! they make it fresh daily.  I'm a huge ranch fan!   I'll give it a 9   it was plenty of food for one adult and child we will totally be back he did feel like a big boy because they didn't have crayons so if you have small kids be prepared to keep them entertained

So impressed! We live right down the street and first time we've been in. The food was impressive. So glad to find a restaurant that does not serve bland blah food. We will be back. Try the grilled salmon and cauliflower on the side:) Server Stephen was great.

Second time at this place. Really like the atmosphere here. Laid back. Contemporary design. Spread out. Beautiful outdoor patio and bar. You never feel rushed in this place. A good representation of AZ cool.   Food is equally excellent. Wonderful beef here for the price. Blackened rib eye steak was tender, juicy Med rare with nice blackened spice on it. A dab of steak butter on top was like frosting!.   Artichoke appetizer was overpriced kinda tough and not worth it. Generous pours on wine but a little on the overpriced side. I can't see spending $17 for a glass of wine. Just doesn't make sense to me. Lower your prices guys. Companion had skirt steak and it was equally very good.   Earlier visit I had brick chicken and was great too. Mashed potatoes are spot on.   A very good restaurant that delivers pretty well.   Bandera down the road is very much like this restaurant but it surpasses on all levels. Just smaller in size.

We saw pretty good reviews here and decided to check it out. We had no idea it was chain. Pretty good steak chain. I would give it more like 3.7 instead of 4 stars.   We had a reservation and we were seated right away with the friendly host. And our server was very nice and polite, with the usual upsale pitch on wine and specials.   My short rib was absolutely delicious and something I would order again. The mash potatoes were pretty good too. My friends hangar steak was also delicious.   We did have an issue with my buddy's steak in which it had to be remade. Seemed to be well done and dry when we asked for it medium. We usually end up eating stuff even if we don't like it too much, but since we're spending $50 or so on a steak, it had to be perfect. Even when it came out the second time, it still wasn't cooked properly and seemed sort of rushed. It really killed the dining experience. And even if the manager and the server brought out a third steak, it would have been too late.   I give 4 stars because the manager and server handled the situation pretty well. They tried their best and it seems to be a fault in the kitchen side.   Would I come back? Yes, great ambience and service. Food was good, aside from my friends steak.

We visited Paul Martin's for dinner on Friday night.  The ambiance of the restaurant was very nice; the food pretty good but on the expensive site.  The service, however, was terrible.  While our waiter was nice, we had to wait painfully for him to take our drink order followed by a painfully long wait to receive our drinks followed by a painfully long wait for our appetizers followed by a painfully long wait for salads followed by a painfully long wait for entrees and dessert.  A lot of staff attention was focused on those in the bar nursing a drink for two hours and splitting an appetizer among many.  In short, the food was good but not exceptional; fairly expensive and the service terrible.  With all the other great alternatives in Scottsdale, I don't know that we will be back.

I gave 3 stars not for service or food that was all great. We had a group of 5 girls an we choose a different restaurant every month to try something new an get together. We look for great happy hour which they had, except not when you are eating in the dining room. Our waitress was kind enough to ask the manager if we could take part, they kindly said yes. We also look for pricing, yelp states it $$, which is what we look for as well but clearly it should of been $$$-$$$$ range. The food an our server Hannah B were awesome!

We stumbled on this at the Borgata shopping mall and were glad we did.  Although they were crowded, we were able to be seated shortly.  They have indoor and outdoor seating but due to the wind we sat inside.   It had a nice vibe and the hostess was very friendly and helpful-even returned to the table to answer a question we had.  My friend had the mushroom soup and loved it.  I had the skirt steak which was very good.  It was tender and tasty and came with some arugula and sliced sweet potatoes..  The service was great and it was a good meal.  I'd definitely go back when in the area.
Fabulous service, delicious food. I can't rave enough about their chocolate cake with cherries. YUM

Divine! Excellent service, attitude and food! Reminds me of houston's service and attention to detail wise. The kale caesar is yummy! Calamari is piping hot, artichoke is delish. Short rib is ammmmmazing. The grilled polenta sooo gooood, added prawns to it, they were perfectly cooked and went well with the dish. Will be back! Again excellent, very cordial service.

Booked in to eat here with my family while we visited town. There was a long wait - at least 20 minutes - for our table to be ready despite the reservation.  A few of his headed to the bar, where we had friendly service, though there was some confusion as a manager asked for my order after we'd already spoken to another barman.   After being seated, we ordered another round of drinks and some appetizers. The appetizers the best part: the shrimp cocktail came with large prawns and the dipping sauce was spicy and delicious. The French onion soup was also good and cheesy.  The entrées were disappointing. My medium-rare filet came out medium and wasn't very flavorful at all. All the sides were over-egged: the spinach was so coated in garlic that it tasted like raw garlic (I love garlic but found it unpalatable). The Brussels sprouts were shaved rather than halved, which was an odd presentation, and so coated in bacon and bacon fat that the whole dish tasted like bacon - again, unpleasantly so.  Our server was pleasant but inefficient, he would visit the table and ask one or two people if they needed anything, then another two people would shout a request after him as he left the table, then it'd take him awhile to circle back. At one point, as the restaurant was thinning out, I waited 15 minutes for a glass of wine. He stopped by and said it was on its way when I was about to ask, so I can't tell if the order hadn't been placed when I asked or if the bar took a long time, but most of our drinks came much more quickly when the restaurant was busier.  The decor and atmosphere are nice, and they made a little extra effort with a dessert for my birthday. Not all bad, but the entrées and style of service really let this place down for me.

Their happy hour runs fro 3-8 and for $13 you can get a burger, craft beer and fries.  The beer I had last time was a Sonoran Victorian IPA from a local Phoenix brewery.  It was very good and paired well with the burger and fries.  The fries were crispy and some of the best I've had anywhere.

Great tasty food and wonderful service. We really enjoyed the outdoor seating and the gluten free options. Happy hour is from 3-8 and the food and drink menu is great for sharing and having a laid back fun time.

We are from Wisconsin so this was our first time eating at a Paul Martin's and it was amazing! Everything we ordered was very delicious and the service was top notch. Our waiter, Cortney, was so personable and made our dinning experience one we will always remember. Thank you Cortney for a great birthday celebration!

Valentine's Day is crazy in most restaurants.  And that could have been the case at Paul Martin's.  However, staff was ready.  The crowd was there.    Our party of 2 arrived a bit early.  We requested a booth.  They accommodated us with no problem.  We were seated shortly before our reservation time of 6:00 p.m., despite the special request.  Trent, our server, was charming, witty, and offered us excellent suggestions.  We had mushroom soup, chicken chimichurri, and salmon.  The food was delicious.  Especially the mushroom soup.  The staff worked like a professional dance company, each person playing off of and helping the others.  When one person noticed that a table needed something, they didn't wait for the 'right' person to do it.  They all lent a hand.  My friend and I observed this throughout our meal.  Our booth was right next to the kitchen.  We had a great time looking over the wall, witnessing first hand the ease and professionalism with which the kitchen executed each meal.  The servers lined up like soldiers, ready to get their plates to the tables.   The manager stopped by our table just before we left.  We offered our thanks and congratulations for such a great experience.    My friend and I will definitely recommend Paul Martin's to our friends.  We will be back!

I had the pleasure of previewing Paul Martin's for lunch last week, before their official opening to the public...  I met my friend Gelie and we had a pleasant, leisurely, and filling experience.  As to be expected with any new restaurant, it seems that the hostess / front area is still working on greeting, seating, confirming reservations, etc... but the great thing is that PMAG seems to have a ton of staff, so I'm hoping they will all "get it" in due time.  Between Gelie and I, we tried the Chicken Tortilla Soup, the Kale Caesar salad, the Fish Tacos, the Mushroom Burger, and the Banana Cream Pie.  Nothing we had was to die for, but it was all tasty.  The service was attentive, ambiance comfortable, and I was pleased to see that despite being a chain (there are currently six California locations), they keep it local by using seasonal products from Valley farmers and purveyors including Black Mesa Ranch, Crow's Dairy Farm, Schreiner's, Hayden Mills, Queen Creek Olive Mill, and more... Their menu isn't overwhelming, but there's a decent amount to choose from.    When I return, I hope to try the artichoke appetizer and perhaps the Greek Salad with prawns and/or the Bistro Burger.  (Gelie and I actually missed that the Three Mushroom Burger we ordered was a mushroom patty and not a beef patty!)  We ate it anyways; who doesn't need more veggies?!  Paul Martin's took over the location where J Alexander's used to be... I hope they stick around for awhile!

Had lunch today with a friend. This could be a great date place.  It has a lovely interior and the outside patio looks like a great place for a date.  We both had the Grilled Salmon. I like mine cooked well and often that means dry and overcooked. It's tough not to over do. But Paul Martin got it just right. It was cooked all the way through and still moist. I thought the portion was large - especially for lunch. The bread didn't win any points. It was kind of a slab of bread and easily skipped (helps the diet plan!). We ended with their Banana Cream PIe and coffee. The Banana Cream pie had a thin layer of chocolate. It didn't overwhelm the bananas. Banana Cream pie can be a heavy dessert. This was light and didn't overwhelm the senses. The coffee was great. Everyone who worked there, were pleasant, polite and had great smiles. They certainly gave the feeling that we were welcomed.   The only things that slightly f took away from the experience. We were at a booth right next to the kitchen. There's a whole row of booths that are parallel to the kitchen. There was a lot of noise before the restaurant was half full. We sat at the outside edge of the booth to hear over the noise. Odd for a place like this.  And the service was great once they discovered us. I sat for over 10 minutes without being acknowledged by a waiter or asking if I wanted a drink while I waited for my friend. My friend arrived and it was almost another 10 minutes before we were noticed. The waiter made up for it - service was amazing after that. Just odd because the restaurant wasn't that busy and many waiters went by but no one seemed to take notice. Very minor point and certainly the waiter gave fantastic service after that.

Restaurant is located where J. Alexander's was and decided to eat there because of a $25 off coupon in the mail.   Made reservations for 3 on a Friday night without any trouble via Open Table. Inside and out, the only difference between the current decor and that from J. Alexander's is the name on the door! Seems like exact same store.  Food was good. No one had any complaints but wasn't blown away either. I had a rib eye and spinach for $36. Wasn't especially good, and was too salty but it wasn't tough and was prepped as I asked.   Overall I feel like this is another restaurant typically found in Scottsdale; a little over priced not great food served in a nice atmosphere. I suppose I'd eat here again but if I had to choose between this place and Roaring Fork, RF would win every time.

Decor was nice. Staff was professional. Food was delicious. Great for a date night. I would say it's a step up from casual dining and the pricing reflects that as well. Would definitely come back again.
Great Happy Hour! We will be back. Small bites and the setting was really nice. Located around many other restaurants this one is for sure one to stop by.

My visit to Paul Martin was like going on a roller coaster ride. At the start, my expectations were high (good service and management) based on what I've heard from prior customers. At the peak of the "ride" (the prime rib), it was enjoyable. The prime rib was cooked perfectly at medium-rare and seasoned well. Near the end, I was disarmed by poor service (incompetent and rude waiter) and gross ice cream (specifically the gingerbread and chocolate flavors. I couldn't eat it.) -- to the point where I just wanted to get out of there or risk vomiting from disappointment and annoyance.   4 stars for prime rib/salad and management downgraded to 2 stars for service and non-lactose free dessert.

Sooooo after loving the Paul Martins in Irvine we thought this would be as good as the others. We went weekly. Unfortunately we were sooo disappointed. Unlike the Hillstone Group which are all great this particular restaurant was a huge let down. Yes, the ambiance is great & we had good service. BUT the food .... we went with another couple on a sat night & ordered filets. They were tasteless . Period. End of story. One person ordered the skirt steak which was chewy. Very. Even the hot fudge sundaes were bad. On par with Dairy Queen.  $200 later per couple I don't think we will return. Bandera here we come ...

Really great food, and really great service. (thanks Victoria)   We had a variety of main dishes and entrée salads.  All were very good.  My husband loved the Beef and Bacon tacos... Another Chicken and Quinoa dish was amazing.  Dessert... oh lord.  While the waitress recommended the apple tart.. we opted for the Chocolate Cake.. which was incredible.  Definitely will be back!

Really disappointing. Dropped by here on a Friday night with my wife hoping for a good dinner but all we got was marginally decent food that was very pricey.  Cocktails were 10 dollars each, not bad, but didn't really taste too good. nothing special.  Servers were unpolished. Felt like they were all newly hired.  Food was not that good. New York Strip Steak was a small portion. Tasted all right, but not nearly enough for a young man. Asked for medium rare but got it medium. Wife ordered medium sandwich but got rare. Had to send it back (after waiting for 10 minutes).   Overall, came out to 40 a pop, but was a lackluster meal.

Horrible food good service waiter was attentive. Spinach cheese was ok at best more spinach then cheese bread was burnt , kids burger ok the bun tasted weird, baby lettuce salad horrible pecans not much more salad dressing hardly , not good at all side order of Mac and cheese had a weird taste paid $88 not worth the money

Have to say, we hadn't been for about a year and always thought it was just OK and a good alternative to Houston's when faced with a 2 hour wait BUT, this is no longer just OK...it has turned into a great spot!  Good was exceptional as was the service (which I must say was always exceptional).  The short ribs, Salmon with quinoa and Meyer lemon, mushroom soup and Caesar Salad, all to die for!  I also appreciate the ability to order an exceptional wine by the glass and their options are that!  Atmosphere is stunning, warm and inviting.

We've gone to this restaurant twice before and decided to go back for my wife's birthday.  The salad had way too much dressing on it that no one ate it.  My wife and her father ordered the salmon that also came with sweet potatoes.  There was so much sauce on the potatoes that it ran into the salmon. It ruined it.  It's sad to say that the bread, and beverages were the best part of the meal.  We won't be going back there.

Came here for my birthday last year and I had such a wonderful time! It was a little hard to hear but the service was friendly. ZERO complaints about the food, all was delicious. Price point is definitely higher than what I would've liked. Overall, great experience and amazing menu!

Been to Paul's a couple of times now. The service is great, all smiles and helpful. The atmosphere is pleasant.  The food in general is mediocre. Last night had the fried chicken and it was boring and a bit dry. Nice salad, had the vegetable spring roll and unfortunately they had just came out of the refrigerator and they were way to cold. Once we let them "thaw" out they were very tasty. Like I said mediocre

Came for lunch and sat on on the patio. Great salad options and a few $12. 00 lunch options. Great atmosphere and service. They have a very popular happy hour from 3:00-7:00pm and a couple nights of price fixed dinners like prime rib on Sunday and fried chicken dinner on Monday. They have Meyer lemons trees that line the patio and they are used in there cocktails.

Time for me to update my previous review.  Yes we had a horrible experience last year at Paul Martin's, the general manager did contact me and comp'd a meal for me and a guest. That experience was great, but then again there were ready and on guard for us.   We returned last Saturday without prior notice. After arriving early, we sat at the bar for cocktails while waiting for our table to be ready. Drinks were great, the bartender engaging, servers were fantastic and stopping by to say hello as we waited. Once our table was ready we headed off to dinner. Our server, Heather English was amazing! We ordered appetizers and additional drinks. While waiting for those fresh bread was brought to the table and The manager stop by to say hello to see if our experience was going well. Yes dinner was spectacular!  But, the service was attentive without her hovering or ever making us feel like we were just 'another' table.  Wonderful experience.   In closing, I highly recommend Paul Martin's as it seems as though the bugs have all been worked out...!  In fact, I'm heading there next Tuesday for lunch with colleagues.

their happy hour deal with burger and a beer is awesome! one of the best tasting and juicy buergers I've ever had and great price. All my firends in my group agreed! Also, nice atmosphere, classy. You just have to get there in time to find a place at the bar area to get happy hour price deals

MEDIOCRATY PERFORMED WITH AVERAGE PRECISION  After reading multiple reviews and hearing the buzz about Monday happy hours, this was the destination for a night out with the wife and good friends.  My wife and I arrived a good 20minutes early but our reserved table was free so the hostess sat us at the table instead of the bar.  We sat at the table a solid ten minutes before our server showed to offer a drink and app.  We figured that this delay was attributable to four menus/place settings but only two people.  At this point we informed the waiter that we intended to run a decent bar bill and take Uber home.  It was disappointing that the waiter did not really demonstrate any mastery of the wine list or even beers available so rather than trying new things we settled for standards and ordered the artichoke appetizer.  Drinks were prompt and our guests arrived as the appetizer showed.  The artichoke was flavorful with good grill char and nicely subtle mayo-based sauce.  But, the waiter forgot to take our guests' drink order.  I wanted to wash the oil from the artichoke off my hands so I got up and then tracked the waiter to order the women a bottle of wine and the men another round of porters.  When I returned the waiter was at the table with the vintner but wrong grape.  I had ordered a Chardonnay but he presented us a Pinot Noir.  At least he didn't open the bottle ahead of presenting it.  I wrote everything above as a draft over a month ago.  After seeing that I never completed it, I was faced with a choice to try and recall or delete.  I thought I would be true to the intent so I looked up the menu to refresh my memory of the meal.  That didn't work...which speaks to the so-so nature of the whole experience.

Great service and atmosphere, as well as a decent drink menu.  But, the food was awful!!!The table bread was obviously recently removed from the freezer, and the balsamic vinegar had turned sour. The French dip from any Arby's is a masterpiece compared to their $19 cold,tiny,boring sandwich.  The macaroni and cheese... Save your money.

Very nice place, friendly staff, and delicious food. The only criticism is we went in for happy hour but the seating is at the bar or communal style and we wanted a table in the bar area. "No happy hour if you want to sit there". So the difference is??? But this is a small knock on the place and we will definitely go back. BTW...I had the Bistro burger and it was outstanding!

Great service and good food.  A bit expensive but a solid meal. Butternut soup, kale Cesar & Brick chicken were all tasty.  We ordered the steak on the Cobb to be cooked medium well and it came out rare!...

MONDAY NIGHTS  $50 - Bottle of Wine, 2 Spring Salads and 2 Entrees of choice.    Are you kidding this is the best deal it town!!!  I have been here twice now for this deal.  First visit we ordered the Annabella Pinot Noir - Great Food wine - a little more bold than typical PN's. My friend ordered the linguine and shrimp and I the hanger Steak.  We split each dish and they were a great compliment. The pasta is great with the garlic and spinach (add a squeeze of lemon and you are golden) and the steak was cooked to perfection.  Who doesnt love steak and mashed potatoes though.  Second visit we ordered the Annabella again because its just so good!  This time I had the Seared Tuna and my dad had the Cedar Plank Steelhead. These are two of my all time favorite dishes! Tuna had the best sear and the crust flavoring pairs so well with the pickled onions and arugula salad with white beans.  I legit licked my plate... not one of my finer moments. My dads salmon was killer in the mushroom jus - they do an excellent job of pairing foods and flavors with one another.    Oh also came here for happy hour (3PM-7PM everyday!) and sat at the bar, great vibe cool bartenders.  Had some Rose with the prosciutto crostini, smoked salmon flat bread, and smoked chicken and wings.  Love it all!! Great spot for a meeting too!

Was given a gift card so had a reason to check this place out. Don't think I would have known about it otherwise. Wanted to go for happy hour, made a reservation since it was Friday & wanted to guarantee a table.   Once we were seated in the empty dining room & I inquired about happy hour, I was informed it restricted to the bar area only. The bar area was packed & happy hour is restricted only to two picnic style tables & four high-tops on the right side of the restaurant. I really couldn't believe there were real estate restrictions! My boyfriend & I decided to sit next to each other instead of trying to awkwardly yelp across the large table (seriously, you feel like you're at kings of the knight table).   Our waiter from the dining side was amazing & super nice, but unfortunately we had to switch once we moved over to the bar. The service in the bar wasn't as great & it literally look about ten minutes to get drinks, but the margarita was really good!  As far as the food goes, I ordered the calamari because it caught my eye when they handed me the dinner menu. So that one was full price, but it was worth it because it was definitely ten times better than the salon street tacos I ordered. The sauce they use on them was so salty it was making me gag. To make it even worse, the lemon that comes with it was coated in salt. My boyfriend ordered the burger + beer + fries deal for $15 (which is pretty sweet since it's any craft beer). He said the burger was delicious.   I don't plan on going back to this place, solely based on the restricted happy hour. Their dinner menu otherwise is overpriced.
Great food at a great price. Decent wine list. Staff was awesome and we never had to ask for refills.

I'm really shocked and suprised at the reviews.  Yes, great atmosphere and great service, but the food is ok considering the price.  I would rate this an overpriced resteraunt wuth good food, but on the bland side.  Not worth the money.

I had a much better experience the 2nd time so am upping the rating! Most everything was spot on from the service to the food. Don't miss the Grilled Artichoke and Salt and Pepper Shrimp appetizers. Both were great! The Mesquite grilled salmon was far better than the wood plank salmon entree I had the 1st time. Pan-seared cauliflower side dish was also very tasty.

I am not sure how to rate food I did not eat! I came in on Sunday to celebrate my anniversary. We specifically chose this place for the prime rib, unfortunately they did not have it despite offering this dish as their feature choice. We were offered an alternative for a significantly higher price. But it was not the price hike that we felt offended by, it was the condescending nature of the manager, we felt very uncomfortable and embarrassed that we even asked for a price match. This reason alone is why we thanked the server and left. I can handle bad food, but bad service is unacceptable.  I want to add the we went across the street to Fleming's and they did not have prime rib either, but they immediately offered an alternative with sides for the same price! We never asked, they offered it to us. They gave us the desert when we mentioned it was our anniversary and the server and the manager gave us a $50.00 gift card and a gift wrapped box full of chocolates!  Simply Amazing!

If I was only rating based on the filet I ordered this would be a 4++; so tender, so perfectly cooked; so yummy.    Unfortunately my husband also ordered the cedar plank salmon which drew down the rating considerably; the presentation on the creamed spinach was a miss...the same very bitter creamed spinach that was served with my dish...it was inedible.  And the mashed potatoes were fine but just sort of uninspiring....the best you can do for a starch side dish is mashed potatoes with some butter?    I do like that they still serve bread with dinner.  The apple crumble was nice to finish with.  Re value....it's a mid range restaurant ambience wise, but price wise it's beyond the mid range experience.   It would be a good choice for happy hour however.

It's a beautiful restaurant lots of parking Front desk is outstanding Tables and decorations top notch Menu has a great selection Bar is full the selection is great Bartenders great and friendly Waiter very knowledgeable and friendly Great selection of wine decent prices Price were consistent with other. Nice restaurants Why not a 5 star  Dear Chef  Please were in 2015 Salt is not the only seasoning.

Dissatisfied- I heard so much about this restaurant I decided  to bring my family to celebrate my wife's birthday. The food did  not disappoint, however the service was less than good. The moment we sat down our waiter rushed us. We eventually order cocktails and our Meals. Everyone in our group of 9 ordered a salad or soup. My wife and daughter had only finished 1/4 if their soup and the waiter brought out our meals.  Embarrassed my family asked if they could have to go containers for their soups.  Someone did mention they were sorry for bringing out everything so quick and then walked away. We ordered two bottles of wine and didn't even have a chance to finish them with our dinner.  Enjoy our food even though we were rushed till the very end. Service was about a bad as I have ever experienced.  No need to return

Came here on Friday night with another couple to celebrate my boyfriends birthday & we had a great time. Had 730PM reservations & were seated right away. My girlfriend and I split a bottle of wine -- Argentina Malbec, really good. And our boyfriends got beer. I was interested in the Pacific Redfish on the menu but was bummed when they were out of it so I settled for Mesquite Salmon -- it was great! My boyfriend got short ribs which were delicious too. We also split a side of the mac & cheese -- very good. We all had a great time here & would definitely come back!
