Good ambience but other than that not good! The menu is rather basic and the food is certainly not worth the price! I had the bistro burger and it was completely devoid of any flavor at all. The menu makes it seem like it comes with cheese, no cheese is a $2 up charge. The other person I was with had the fish tacos-they were ok that was it. Once again not a lot of flavor. The same person had the mushroom soup and said it was actually pretty good. In summary, basic food with no flavor and a very high price tag.

Very impressive restaurant. The service staff are extremely attentive, the food is excellent. We love sitting at the bar for happy hour. Their burger, fries and a cold beer is only $13.00. The burger was done perfectly on a toasted sourdough bun. The sweet potato fries were hot and crisp. We continue to receive outstanding service and food at PM. Paul Martin's is always our go to Scottsdale restaurant.
The happy hour food was amazing! Great atmosphere and very nice service. Was really busy though....call ahead!

Love this place! The food is great and the drinks are always on point! I've been here for the Father's day brunch and now we are here for the Mother's day brunch. It's a little on the pricey side but it's well worth it!

Service was excellent! Imad was our waiter very knowledgable of the menu. I had the cedar plank salmon and my boyfriend had the skirt steak both very good. Monday night special a bottle of wine two salads and any entree for 50$! So cheap. We also had the strawberry shortcake and banana cream pie super yum!!!

I got to say I thought this place would be better.... great location, great service, but the food is average. We ate with other 5 people and everyone left feeling the same way. Everyone said the same thing.... "I thought it would be better".

What a beautiful experience!!! Amy G. took great care of us. Impeccable service Amy! She will take great care of you. The atmosphere is classy, warm and welcoming. The food was outstanding! It's so hard to get a burger that is actually medium like I like it and not medium-well. This one was perfectly done. We plan to come back really soon and will bring friends! Thank you from The Freemans...

The food was pricey and the well drinks were ridiculously overpriced, thought for a minute I was in NYC! We had the prime rib medium rare. one came medium rare, one came medium. The waitstaff was the saving grace, they were very solititous.

This place has unexpectedly become one of my favorite if not favorite restaurant in Scottsdale.   I originally came here because it's close to my house and offers 1000 point tables on opentable.   I have since been back several times.  They have great specials Sunday through Wednesday.  Monday's they have a 3 course dinner for two and a bottle of wine for $49.  Tuesday's they offer a 3 course fried chicken dinner for $22.   Besides the fried chicken,  my favorite dish here is the brick chicken.   It's perfectly marinated with the perfect amount of herbs and spices.   Their menu is simple and delicious.
Our server Hannah was terrific!  We came to celebrate a graduation, and they treated us great.  The food was delicious and the atmosphere nice.  We will be back for sure.

It is my personal opinion that for about $100 for two is was a "I won't be back". The appetizer was skmpy. My main course was oily and the salad was truly pitiful. AND please stop asking if we want more to drink.

Went in for the first time with a friend a couple nights ago and Kathie was our server. She explained the menu and wine.  She gave us a couple of her favorite dishes and explained each of their preparations. My guest had the short ribs which were tender and full of flavor. I had the skirt steak and it was the best I've had. Kathie also recommended a wine to go with our dinner. We finished up with the pistachio ice cream. Everything was amazing and I can't wait to return!

Well..where can I start..we had reservations and it was our last night in Scottsdale. I had previously eaten here twice. Food is great. Our server, Amy,  was awesome but we originally came here for happy hour. However, the unfriendly and unapologetic manager, named Clyde said we could not have happy hour specials sitting at a table. Ridiculous!!! We all are still going to have dinner. We made the whole experience of a great meal flop. I will never eat at Paul Martins again because of their jerk of a manager Clyde!!!!! Sorry Paul Martin!!! Good food but a very unintelligent and inarticulate manager!

I don't know what the bad reviews are! People in a cranky mood, who were at a different restaurant is the only explanation.   This place was so great for dinner. Definitely trying to give off a higher end vibe, which is fine, I appreciate great fine dining service! But they don't even have to go that fancy with the service, the food seriously speaks for itself and is wonderful. We had the spinach dip to start which was fantastic and the best I've had. It came with delicious slices of bread and sun dried tomato. Fiance had the short rib, a perfect portion size and delicious. I ordered the steak cobb with a side of mac n cheese. The mac n cheese was great, I wouldn't say I need it but it was definitely tasty. The salad on the other hand was so beautiful in presentation and I loved every bite. I didn't even use the blue cheese dressing they brought on the side. The vinaigrette it is tossed in is perfect.   Service could not have been better- our waters were never empty, servers were attentive while not being annoying or overbearing and the ambiance is quiet. You can get away with being both casual and dressy here.  I highly recommend Paul Martins for Lunch or Dinner. The servers are excellent and the food top notch.

I think they are still finding their footing, but the staff was all incredibly nice and accommodating, in sure if you alert them to any issues they will take care of you. I enjoyed my brief time here, for sure.

Our food was excellent (Salt and Pepper Shrimp, Butter Lettuce salad, Fresh Fish Tacos and a good wine selection). The three star rating is due to the service.  The service was extremely rushed. Three times before we were done with our plates various staff members (not our waiter) tried to remove our plates. We were just truing to enjoy our meal while also enjoying each others conversation. It appeared as if you did not have a fork in your hand and were not actively eating the staff was instructed to try to clear your plate. Due to the quality of the food we will try this restaurant again.

Ordered from this place for delivery. Ordered a Beef Dip sandwich and it was great! Best au jus I've had in a while, very flavorful. Sandwich was good texture and not soggy. Fries were shoestring with potato skin still on it and lightly seasoned - perfect me for that's how I like them! Not too greasy. Food arrived well packaged with the fries and sandwich separate. I'd order from here again and I'll definitely visit the restaurant for a proper meal in the future.
Good restaurant and atmosphere.  We ordered the braised short ribs which were extremely tender and the chimichurri chicken which was full of flavor.

Great menu ! Great service ! Not your average restaurant. Makes you feel special. Great waiter but I'm sure tired of super young snobby hostesses who can't get a real job & are pissed this is it at age 18 ! Lol

Excellent across the board. We had the prime rib special on our anniversary. Great service, great food, 5 stars all day long. Anyone rating this place differently is nuts. Try it, you won't be disappointed.

Passing through from Houston to L.A., we chose this place and had no regrets. From start to finish and considering every aspect of a dining experience, this place ranks in the top 5 meals we've ever had.  Touché Paul Martin (Fleming), you've done it again.
Great experience  every time we go to Paul Martin's! Food is excellent, staff is friendly and attentive and atmosphere is  appealing.

We went a few weeks ago.  Everything was good.  Calamari was flavorful and cooked perfect.  I had the chicken under a brick and it was pretty stellar.  I'd go again for that.  Perfectly cooked.  The mahi my wife had was a great dish too.  Drinks were well poured and everything was reasonable in cost.  We'll go again

Wow! It's my 4th visit and time to post! Great happy hour...and the Monday dinner for two is nuts! Great deal...great food...and impeccable service! Derek...Trent...and the manager on duty Eric....make me want this to be my weekly spot! That pork chop...yeeeeeeees! Seriously....if you have a palate for good food and wine....stop here! I'm a transplant...and have yet to have a bad experience......I would post pics.....post too late...I cleaned my plate and finished the wine!
Went in for Happy Hour tonight on a "blind date" Paul our server was awesome! Food and drinks were great too!
GREAT PLACE- GREAT SERVICE- place has awesome atmosphere- happy hour specials are all very good!  bartenders fun and nice- will be back for sure!
Superb Service, Excellent food  Outstanding atmosphere. A Gem

Probably the best happy hour in town. I had the smoked wings and tater tots (which are more like fried mashed potato balls) so who can go wrong with that?! My boyfriend had a burger/fries/beer combo for $13! The food was hot, fresh and delicious. The portions were very generous too and the ambiance is so inviting and romantic. Will definitely be back!!

The food, coffee and restaurant is very well put together. I would love to try this chain again. Sit out enjoy the sun, before you leave to go back to the freezing cold weather. Enjoyed everyone who work at this particular place. Very happy with my steak cob salad, but get it with some spinach mixed in it. Also the Mac n cheese is not your normal, it is fabulous. Coffee is organic and local, everything is fresh and bought from the USA and organic.

We had a phenomenal waitress, Kathie, she was very attentive and professional despite how busy the restaurant was.  Everything was exceptional! I had the Hanger Steak with Chimichurri and mashed potatoes, this is the first time I have ever had hanger steak cooked to perfection and juicy. Shocker! My husband had the Salmon fish tacos WOW! they were delicious, I'm not sure what kind of sauce they had but it was wonderful.  As if I hadn't already ate enough I got the Chocolate Cake with a double espresso, this was the BEST chocolate cake I've ever had. I would return just for the chocolate cake! The cake itself is moist and chocolatey without being too much and the FROSTING yummmm! So much for me not liking cake or chocolate much!?

Lovely dinner. We often come here , we love the sustainability focus of this spot. Our server Trent was AMAZING!  He was super friendly & knew his stuff! He suggested the Ribeye with faro & It was oh so good with the sizzling butter and cooked to perfection! We also had salt & pepper shrimp, oysters and the pork ribs . Everything was delicious . We will definitely be back and are excited to check out their Sunday Brunch and HH which is 3-7pm .. DAILY!! Which is alright , alright alright in my book!

My boyfriend and I just had dinner here tonight and I have to say that it was great! To start off the restaurant is beautiful. The service was great! Their cocktails are amazing...if you like martini's you have to try their raspberry martini...it's delicious!!! And for all those chocolate lovers out there, like me, the Chocolate Devils Cake is phenomenal!!!  Highly recommend this place!

The manager was very attentive and most of all welcomed us as we were visiting for the first time experiencing a special occasion.   The Monday $50 special is amazing and not only is it a great deal, but they understand that because of the deal, they will attract new guests and work hard to make them return guests.   Love this spot and can't wait to go back!

Service and ambiance was wonderful. Live music good food. My only complaint is I think their wine is over priced. I went with the $12. Dollar glass and that was the low end. The waitress recommend the $25 glass but I passed. I recommend this place if you don't mind spending $ on wine and your not like me and order 3 glasses cheers

We had reservations at 9:00  and got here by 8:50.Being Valentine's day they were fully booked but we were promptly seated.Service was friendly and fast.  We ordered Raspberry Martini (house vodka,lemon juice and sweet vermouth). Glenkinchie 12.  Salt and pepper shrimp (coated with a buttermilk batter) served with pesto aioli. Sweet potato fries. Chimichurri chicken (chicken breasts with wild mushrooms farro,spinach,onions).  I actually wanted the brick chicken with mashed potatoes but they were out of it for the day.The Chimichurri was well done and had a nice crispy skin.They served me fries instead of sweet potato fries so the manager recommended we snack on them and quickly got that fixed.The Raspberry martini tasted as good as it looked.The house Ciabatta wheat bread was fresh out of the oven.  Our server took some wonderful pictures.They also have a patio.Overall the experience was Great and we came home a Happy couple.  Cheers!

We thoroughly enjoyed this new restaurant.  The place has a good vibe and while we came with my mom for dinner, my husband and I would absolutely come back to just enjoy drinks at the bar.   We were seated right away and had great service from a well trained waitress who knew seemingly everything about both the drink and food menus.  Our meals were delicious and we all agreed we would be back.

This is our once or twice a week dinner place. Don't miss Monday night wine dinner special, 2 dinner entrees, 2 salads, bottle of wine $60! Happy hour is great and they fly in pacific nw salmon daily. Right now they have Dungeness crab! Food is fresh service attentive, just go you'll enjoy it

One word...service!  I'm extremely impressed with their service here. Our server was attentive and my water was always filled. Only thing was he didn't refill our bread.  We ordered the cheese board, mussels, chicken parm., and the clam linguine. The mussels are tasty and spicy (be warn). The chicken parm. was decent but I would recommend ordering something else. My clam linguine was delicious. Perfect amount of clam to linguine ratio!! Now that's hard to find.   Overall, I would go back again. Just have to pick the right dish!
Great service and great food. Really enjoyed the ribs, Mac and cheese, and burgers. Short ribs were fork tender and they even had grated horseradish available. And we got in without reservations!

The Black Angus Steakhouse is way way way better than it. The New York strip steak which is the most expensive one is just about average, maybe even worse than the steak from Sizzler. The fish taco is OK, but I would prefer the one from Outback. Also the waiting time was unbearable long, we didn't made a reservation as the day we visited was Tuesday. I guess the only reason people would dine in there is that they can use the Amex spend 50+ get 25 back offer.
Very typical Scottsdale place, overpriced average food. The happy hour specials were really marginal except for the burger.

We love this restaurant! It's beautiful, has a great patio, has amazing food, and amazing service. Why can't every restaurant have it together like this? I've never had a bad meal at this establishment or questionable service. The menu is varied enough to be interesting and everything is delicious!!

I haven't been here in awhile, pleasantly surprised and thrilled they're adding back some of the old menu items. My dining partner and I stopped coming because we were bored with the limited offerings after revamping the menu. We came for lunch, our server was very pleasant (slight spread thin as service was a bit long at times), atmosphere is always nice.  We ordered a Beer while looking over the menu. We ordered the Steak and Bacon Taco and the Fish Tacos (finally a different choice of fish, I chose the Redfish Tacos, do not like Salmon in general). The food came out hot and fresh and tasted very good.   We still like this place especially with the change-up of menu items. My only comment is they also up the prices of drinks, $8 for a Hopnosh IPA, really? Well then, maybe order just 1 at that price when normally we would have a few.  Still a great place for lunch.

Visiting Phoenix for work and decided to stay in nice Scottsdale instead of Downtown to avoid the commotion of Trump's rally in Phoenix.  The food was good.  The ribs were fall off the bone.  I didn't enjoy the slaw much.  I was able to sub the fries for cauliflower.   The service was very attentive.  Upscale restaurant gave me additional napkins for the ribs since it was a tablecloth and cloth napkins place.  An extra special touch was the warm napkin with a lemon instead of a wet nap.
Great restaurant service excellent! Best mushroom soup ever!!!! Clean professional with class!!!!! Try it worth it!

The family visited Paul Fleming's owned Paul Martin's on Christmas Eve.  There was a little miscommunication with regards to the lady who calls those who have reservations as she told us they could make anything Gluten Free but when we arrived, both the waiter Trent who was great and the manager in the red shirt (who btw did not even know their was gluten in reg. pasta) said they were not able to make things GF.  So a little bummed I could only get a salad or soup and a app.  We started off with the artichoke app which is enough for two people which was real yummy much better than other places.  My friend had the pacific redfish and he said the spinach was amazing.  They did not offer anyone on our table bread or butter and I noticed everyone else had bread on their tables.  My other friend had the salmon salad.   I opted for the Butternut Squash Soup without the pesto on top as I can not have EVOO which their pesto was made with.  It was very thick and tasted like it had chili flakes in it.  Not a fan of the Butternut squash soup just average.  The best place to get the butternut squash soup is actually right across the street from Paul Martin's.  Overall my friends thought is was a bit expensive $15.00 for a glass of wine and $4.00 for a teabag /cup of hot tea.  The service was right on and Trent was amazing.  Three at the table - I only had an app and the soup, my friend had a salad and side of brussel soups which was sautéed in heavy EVOO with onions, then other entrée was the redfish and a trio of ice cream bill before tip was $106.00.  Little expensive and I came in hungry and left hungry not much on the menu if you are vegan GF.  They should have more GF vegan options.  I would come back just for the artichoke which was very yummy!!!

Delicious! We were seated immediately and Carl was our server. He was awesome! He checked with the chef on some preparation options for me made some stellar recommendation. He even talked us into dessert!  He was  friendly and personable without being intrusive. The food was great and everything came out perfectly. I would highly recommend this restaurant if you are seeking some healthier options or just want some good food with a spin on traditional dishes.

Some things happen by chance but even chance happenings are meant to be. Since another restaurant was still getting over brunch in the late afternoon and other area spots are steakhouses, Paul Martin's was the obvious choice for lunch.  So go ahead Paul, make my day. In fact...I think you've made my life. I can't dine out the same anymore, at least not for the next couple of weeks. Let me keep the memory of our rendezvous fresh in mind. Our time together was well spent.   It's nice to see an upscale restaurant serve customers quality food and filling quantities at comparable prices. Everything was easy to eat and I didn't get tired of any one dish. Needless to say I stuffed myself and almost considered sneaking a couple bites off the carnivores.   This is what they ordered:  SALT & PEPPER SHRIMP starter (19.00) - eight large shrimp, lightly fried and served with green onion shavings and pesto aioli. This looked so yummy. The fry was golden brown and not greasy at all.    BBQ PORK RIBS kitchen classic dish (26.00) - fall off the bone rack of meat with sauce and sides of french fries and slaw. The ribs looked large and plentiful. I didn't see any fat or chewiness on them.  STEAK & BACON TACOS kitchen classic (17.00) - two tacos of mesquite grilled angus in corn tortillas with avocado cucumber salad. I was told the meat was filled with quality and flavor.  COLUMBIA RIVER STEELHEAD sandwich (14.00) - a filet of grilled salmon topped with arugula and pesto aioli between a soft roll with a side of thinly cut fries. No morsel was wasted.  PM has a concise menu. Only one dish was labeled vegan: a warm quinoa bowl with mushrooms, avocado, and veggies, but few options can be ordered vegan without the aioli or cheese. Vegetarians have pickins from each section except the kitchen classics.  I ordered:  SEASONAL SOUP starter (8.00) - small bowl of creamy butternut squash with a drizzle of olive oil and a couple of croutons. Best bowl of butternut I've had. Mild sweetness which I enhanced with a dash of ground pepper.   THREE MUSHROOM burger (14.00) - mushroom and cheese patty topped with arugula on a brioche-type roll dressed with pesto aioli and served with a side of sweet potato fries.    FIELD GREENS side salad (6.00) - generous portion of fresh crispy greens and slivers of cabbage, tomato, red onion, and sunflower seeds in vinaigrette.  PAN ROASTED CAULIFLOWER side (6.00) - roasted cauliflower florets and whole garlic cloves in oil and lemon juice. The addition of the citrus gave a delicious tang and cut through the oil nicely. The menu lists parmesan cheese as another ingredient to the dish, but thankfully I didn't taste any cheese. It was good without it.  It's unusual for me to finish everything on my plate(s), but it helped that saltiness and seasoning were perfect. The fries didn't even leave a greasy residue on my fingers or face. That's good cooking!   5 stars for Paul Martin. Good service. Good food.

This place is quickly becoming one of my favorite Happy Hours (and in Scottsdale, that is saying a lot!) The food is fresh and mostly organic. The servers are friendly and helpful. The drinks are top shelf ie Tito's martinis and the soft seating on the patio is super comfy!

I want so bad to give this place five stars. It has some really great things going for it. I've now eaten here twice: once for their happy hour and once for their $49 wine dinner. Now here's the good:  - service: both the bartender for the happy hour and our server at dinner were wonderful. No complaints.  - food: very good. Loved the salad the meal came with. Cedar plank salmon and poke were also good.  - price: amazing. You can't beat the $49 wine dinner.  Now the reason why I only give this place three stars:  - AC: my sister and I were both dripping sweat throughout our dinner. It was way too hot in the dining room. Even our server was like, "PLEASE complain to the manager." She was obviously hot too.Unfortunately, no matter how good the food is, it's hard to enjoy while dripping sweat. The manager did come over and apologize and give us free scoops of ice cream, but we had just had a slice of pie, which brings me to...  - Banana Cream pie: I did not like it. The custard was super thin and tasted of artificial banana flavor like a banana runt. Do they add some kind of banana extract?? Ick. Also didn't love the whipped cream. Had a little fridgy flavor to it, like it had been sitting for a while. I really wish the manager had just comped the pie instead of giving us ice cream we were too full to eat because I felt slightly resentful about spending $10 on that not so great piece of pie. The fact that we shared it and left some on the plate says a lot. Neither of us enjoyed it very much.  - I do wish they had a better selection of beer and a salad on the happy hour menu, but that's not a big deal.  -Parking: parking is difficult and they basically force you to valet. It's free, but I still prefer to just self park.  Will I go back? Yes, I believe I will. The food and service really are good. I hope for a five star experience next time. And also air conditioning.
I visited for happy hour and the waiter forgot two things on our order and was slow. The food was ok on happy hour drinks were good. Then I visited for dinner and the food was average and overpriced.

Yummy again!  The grilled artichoke was a hit for me again.  My entree was a skirt steak with roasted sweet potatoes.  Others had the baked salmon, salmon tacos and the fried chicken.  All good. The only problem this time was service.  Our server did not cover the table well.  We waited a long time for dessert and wound up cancelling the order. Good food always, good service most of the time.

Had a great lunch today. Always a comfortable environment.  What was really outstanding was our server, Courtney.  He was terrific.  Make sure you order the Mushroom Soup...it's a winner, as well as many other things on the menu.

I am a big (and I mean really, really, big) fan of Paul Martin's. My partner and crime Brian V. and I have gone to the El Segundo location for years and go to the new Rancho Cucamonga location at least once a week. That being said, we were looking forward to visiting the Scottsdale location while here on vacation. We dined here three times in 4 days, the first two being for happy hour and the last one for dinner. We had a great experience for the happy hours, and thought we had a great experience for dinner...until the food poisoning hit. Yes, Brian V., my partner in crime, had the seafood platter as his starter, and within 1 hour of finishing our meal (as we were shopping in the Scottsdale Fashion Square) the chills, sweat, and uncontrollable vomiting began.  I got him back to the hotel and promptly called the restaurant to alert them to the problem. Michael, the manager I spoke with was not very helpful, and clearly did not know how to handle the situation. He told me to check in with the other manager tomorrow morning...yeah, not helpful. As I write this at 11:20 pm poor Brian V. is very ill, vomiting and experiencing diarrhea. Thanks for ruining our vacation Scottsdale Paul Martin's.

Came here for happy hour and was not disappointed. Our server, Shannon, was extremely friendly and helpful. My husband and I shared the salmon lettuce cups, the cheese platter and macaroni and cheese. All were delicious and the portions were just enough to ride us over.   The mojito and cosmopolitans were perfectly made.   Cosy atmosphere. Overall, a really lovely place.

Our 1st time here.  Monday night $50 special (2 entrees, 2 house salads and a bottle of wine).  I had the brick chicken and my husband had the marinated pork chops.  Both were incredible!  My brick chicken was so tender and came with roasted garlic and really nice mashed potatoes.  It was so good I'd probably order the same thing next time around.  He said his pork chops were very good too!  If you go on a Monday, make reservations and use the valet to park (the parking lot was totally full).  All in all, it was an enjoyable dinner with excellent service.

Four and a half but for a corporate chain very impressed! Great grilled artichoke and organic greens followed by excellent salmon and king crab legs. Nice wine list, not super original but good and good kids meals with much appreciated fruit as well as fries. As a plus, the music was straight from my IPod, Vampire Weekend, Spoon, Bright Eyes etc. Manager checked on us and server was efficient and pleasant.

We had Easter dinner at Paul Martins this year for the first time. While the restaurant was clean and the service was fine, I thought the food was okay at best and grossly over-priced. Had to send back my wife's plate because it was under cooked, which is something I typically never do. I know that's not terrible but wanted better for Easter dinner.  I am not inclined to return.
What can I say?   Desserts is amazing.  Not too sweet.  . Housemade Eggnog was delicous.   Dustin was a great server.  :)
Just had Mother's Day brunch, medium at best!  Server was fabulous but the food was bland and medium, will stick to dinner, if at all.  Thanks for trying!

Great food, beer selection and happy hour.  Ask for   Steven at the bar.  He gave me excellent service.  The food and his knowledge along with a great personality made this a 10 out of 10 for me.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

We visited this location over two years ago and boy what a difference. Service was extremely prompt and the staff was very hospitable. We ordered the Monday wine special and had the New York Strip and Braised Short Rib. The salads were just a filler. The field greens in this salad are way to earthy for my taste. The Prime New York Strip was so tender I used my fork to cut it. The short Rib was good but it  tasted reminiscent of a pot roast. The most notable change this visit was the service. Our server was very attentive and the support staff was a little overly aggressive while bussing our table. I was chewing my last bite, fork in hand  and someone appeared to take my plate. While I get it efficient service it seemed rushed more than efficient.

Absolutely top notch in my book,  While the regular menu surely is a little pricey, it delivers on the quality and taste.  A great cocktail & wine menu round it out.  As happy hours go, I really like the offerings. Not absolutely the cheapest HH prices, but really, you get what you pay for, and the HH offerings having me coming back for more.  Ambiance is casual elegant, and the service is always quite good.

Can't wait to return for a mushroom burger.  Usually restaurants will serve a vegetarian burger made with soy, beans, or grains, but Paul Martin stands out from the rest. The restaurant's Three Mushroom burger https://youtu.be/A93Np5gMzt0 is so good and hearty, I never want to eat another grain burger.   Get them grains outta my face!  PM's burger is a thick patty made of all 'shrooms and cheese. It's topped with arugula and aioli between a soft bun. Fantastic flavors. Order it with side salad, fries, or cole slaw (?).  Yum yum.

I went here only because of the reviews.  In fact, I was expecting to go somewhere else, but changed my reservation because of the reviews.  WOW, was I disappointed.  I thought the menu choices were not so great.  The food was very average.  The service was below par.  The table next to me, was discussing among themselves how poor their experience was; I wanted to join in their conversation.  I did not like my appetizer, I did not like my main course and I did not like the dessert.

I hate to say that I wasn't very impressed with this place.  We arrived for dinner on a week night and there were very few people dining. It took the waiter far longer than it should have to retrieve our drink order. The drinks remained empty without an offer for refills.  We shared the butcher's board - a selection of local cheeses and artisan salumes - it seemed subpar and overpriced.  Our dinner entrées were about the same. Nothing special.  For all the hype this place really didn't have the "it" factor for me.

I have been here a few times since my parents love the place and live close to it.  I can honestly say this is the best Happy Hour I have had in the Phoenix area and have been telling my friends to go check it out.  Where else can you get a small sirloin with a special sauce this delicious with shoestring fries (or garlic mashed potatoes if you ask) with a cocktail/wine/beer all for $13?  I have also had the dining room experience, and it was great, but the HH is just too good to pass up.  I tried the other things that my parents order on the HH menu and it's all very tasty and a great deal.  They insisted on giving me a free dessert for my birthday, that was three days away just because they are cool like that.  Go between 3 and 7pm any day in the bar and get blown away!

This place is totally overrated. I feel like it is a Houston's wanna-be and it is unsuccessful in that effort. I've been here twice and the service has always been nice and helpful. But the food tho! The food is either under-cooked or over overcooked or oversalted or too sweet etc. Some of their items are actually even weird... We ordered spinach dip and were provided with a soupy cheese mixture with fresh spinach not even cut up floating in the soup. In other words, in order to eat the spinach dip you had to use a knife. Who needs a knife to eat spinach dip?  The taste was fine but it was weird. Other things I have had that I was not impressed with include the artichoke (if you want a real artichoke go to Houston's) and the cedar plank salmon (barely cooked). However, I ordered the short rib dinner the first time I was there and that was quite good. Besides that, everything has been somewhere between bad and meh.

We were in the neighborhood doing some shopping and popped in on a whim. The decor was elegant and the dimmed lighting along with big windows allowed for business meetings or casually formal luncheon. I ordered the fish tacos which were delicious but wish they would have come with a side. My husband ordered the burger which was on the small side for his liking. The fries on the side were a divine throwback to my grandma's homemade fries. All in all a nice place. Not kid friendly. Prices are high for lunch but considering the area, I guess it's normal.

This was our first time at Paul Martins and it did not disappoint! The salad was fresh and delicious. My husband and I both ordered the Halibut as per recommendation from our waitress and she was spot on. I think this was the best halibut I have ever had. It was very lightly blackened in a light cream sauce surrounded by asparagus and grilled cherry tomatoes. The tomato's were sweet as sugar! The fish was cooked perfectly. I especially liked that there was no starch on the plate. I could have ordered it separately if I wanted. The service was great and we loved the atmosphere, definitely a place that you can bring the family. Not stuffy at all. I must say we will be returning soon!

We had a great dinner. I ordered the brick chicken and my Mom got the braised short ribs. The portions were huge so we took it home. Our server was Angelo and he was fantastic. He answered all our questions and was so friendly and professional. We will definitely be back again.

Came here with a friend for a business dinner. It was an excellent choice. We started out with the artichoke appetizer which I never had before and was absolutely fantastic.   Our server, Amy L was great. She recommended an excellent red wine, the Educated Cabernet was delicious. I had the braised pork rib for dinner and this was so tender and juicy and succulent, it was a game changer!  No need for a knife at all. Finish things off with the banana cream pie for dessert.

Really good food. Went in for lunch on Monday for the wine dinner for two special. Good deal for the money. Regular prices are too high for how small the portions are in my opinion. I had to send my steak back due to being undercooked but everything else was fine. Server was very attentive and thorough. I'd recommend it but not unless you're going for a well priced deal.

(4.50 stars)  For the final dinner of our Arizona vacation we only had to venture across the street from our motel, the Scottsdale Hilton Resort.  I had enjoyed dinner at a Paul Martin's location in the Los Angeles area two years ago, and was anxious to dine here.  The physical layout of the Scottsdale property was sleek and modern, with heavy emphasis upon dimmed lighting, chrome and glass-- not at all unlike the LA location.  Michelle P. was our server on Tuesday, and she was personable, pleasant, knowledgeable and reasonably prompt-- a very good job.  We skipped the appetizers, soups and salads and went right for our entrees.  Our sons and I each ordered a different steak (skirt, hanger and New York strip), while my wife chose the grilled salmon.  Each was cooked to the requested temperature, tender, nicely seasoned and attractively plated.  A sautéed "heirloom" spinach accompanied my steak, as it had my salmon two years ago.  Then, as now, the particular variety was properly seasoned, but otherwise flavorless.  Unlike my prior encounter, the tough lower stems had been trimmed; tender and tasty, but not memorable.  The boys each enjoyed their steaks, and my wife, the salmon.  The four of us broke from our normal practice and ordered desserts; three for the table.  Chosen were the homemade ice cream sampler, banana cream pie and the chocolate layer cake.  Each selection was superb; neither overly sweet, nor lacking in comfort food value.  An excellent meal!
It was really good, especially for the price. I'm used to paying 2-3x more for less quality. The food here is great and definitely a place I'd recommend. Great date spot, too!
Honestly I didn't think it lived up to the hype. It was just a step below what houston's is. It's not bad by any means, I'd just rather eat at houston's for a better meal.

Have gone here 3 times and the third visit will be my last. Went for steaks, and didnt mind paying the almost $50 cost for them. I ordered medium well, which is supposed to be mostly cooked with a slight amount of pink. It arrived medium rare for both of ua, and they were both sent back. Mine came back charred and over done, so it got sent back again. My date finished her entire meal and drink before we asked where mine was. Several minutes later, it comes back butterflied, and well done, and smaller in size(like they had cut my old piece down, flipped it into two connected pieces and replated it without the char). Disgusting! I was embarrassed for the waiter and flabbergasted that they would treat a customer that way. Restaurants come and go in Scottsdale, and the ones that take pride in their work are the ones I frequent.

I really like this place! I have eaten here at least five times, and the food and service is always very consistent. They have a great artichoke appetizer to start - almost as good as Hillstone's legendary artichoke. The drinks are always poured as if they are doubles, so be careful if you're going to drive after having a cocktail. If you are taking Uber, or have a designated driver, than this is the place to have dinner and drinks.  Tonight I had the roasted chicken with mashed potatoes. Roasted garlic cloves are used as a garnish on the chicken, and it is served in a generous broth. The potatoes are very finely whipped and contain lots of butter - just the way I like them! I highly recommend that you eat here the next time you are in the Scottsdale and Lincoln area.

We come here at least once a month for their Sunday prime rib. It really is delicious! And we feel like we are stealing the price is so good! How can you beat $25 for a salad, a large piece of prime rib with mashed potatoes, and homemade ice cream? They also have a Monday night wine dinner (great deal!!) and a fried chicken Tuesday which I've heard is also very good!  The atmosphere is very nice-beautiful wood beamed high ceilings with fresh orchid arrangements and very comfy booths with dim lighting. The staff is top notch and the entrees are great.  we've had the chimichurri steak (yummy and garlicky!) the free range chicken-small portion but equally as tasty, the marinated skirt steak is cooked perfectly and very tender...the street tacos are pretty good as well if you want an appetizer. We are regulars here :)

Amazing is al I have to say! My husband and I popped in for date night. Our server Steven was great! Food was out of this world. So much flavor!! Highly recommend the roasted cauliflower and grilled artichoke. Expensive...yes. But wonderfully prepared! Will totally come back!!!

Our family of 6 went Sunday eve for the first time and it took them 15 mins to get our drink order to us. We ordered wine and beer!  We were not given water until after drinks arrived.  Our resv. was at 7 and at 830 we were still waiting for dinner to be served.  No explanation was given and it was not busy.  Service is SLOW.  Our waitress was very attentive and nice but that does not help with things being slow.  The St. Louis Ribs were partially very tender/part grisley.  The salmon was very good for 2 of us with the prawns being just ok, not much taste to the dish.  Banana cream pie was very good.  The decor is beautiful and upscale..............it's too bad the rest wasn't up to par.

Our server was friendly/polite and the food was great. If you drink scotch here, don't add ice or water. They don't filter the water/ice, and it tastes like crap. I ordered a Macallan with 3 ice cubes. Completely ruined the drink. Yeah, some people think you shouldn't add ice/water to scotch. Let me drink my drink the way I want to. Anyway, the ice was so gross, it ruined the $20 drink. Completely offensive and a waste of money. That's why you only get 3 stars.

In Scottsdale from Seattle on business.  Paul Martin's was near the hotel so my business colleague and I thought we would give the place a try.   Initial impression from the parking lot was that it may be out of our price range.   But we were pleasantly surprised by the food prices as well as the service.  I had the skirt stake which was outstanding.   And Mary, our server did an awesome job in taking care of us.   I would highly recommend!

Reminds me of a Fleming's steakhouse...it is actually the same founder I believe...fantastic happy hour and great service at the bar. It was surprisingly busy at the restaurant for a Tuesday evening...Apparently they have a great deal going on Monday evenings for dinner for two for $ 53 that includes two salads, two entrees, and one bottle of wine (any bottle with a square next to it). Atmosphere is chill and luxurious at the same time, highly recommended...

Summary - terrific restaurant  Ambience:  great balance between fancy and casual. You can come dressed up or in jeans.   Bar:  Eric was great, and made a mean old fashioned. It's the mark of a good bar to me., but they have a wide variety of items. In addition, they have some decent happy hour options.   Food:  I had the organic green salad (with peanut sauce) and the hangar steak. To me, any restaurant that had hangar steak on the menu is on its way to a good review. I special ordered it blackened (like their ribeye), and it did not disappoint. It was cooked to taste (med rare), and the flavor was great.  For under $25, it was a great value.   Dessert included the ice cream trio - their mocha is legit - and the others hold their own.   Service was very good - I ate at the bar, and their service was on par with great restaurants.    If you're in Scottsdale, it's worth a visit.  Not 5 stars only because I don't typically give those out (not that I know anything). But I would definitely come back.

Classy American Restaurant   Paul Martin serves solid food, but it's greatest strengths are its beautiful interior and excellent service. I'm from the South and a bit picky on fried chicken, but the fried chicken here was really good! The crust was crisp and substantial without being heavy, and the dish provides a nice combination of white and dark meat. The corn was also tasty, cooked Mexican style. The burger and salad were pretty standard but good. We were taken aback by the strawberry shortcake coming on a biscuit, but I'm sure it's good if you like bread/biscuits. The servers are top notch and very attentive. Overall a lovely experience!

Went here for the first time last weekend and loved it!  The whole staff was very friendly and attentive, from the hostess, to the bartender, to our server, Hannah.  Everyone seemed to put hospitality at the forefront.  Their menu is full of enticing options, yet approachable; not too overwhelming.  My husband and I shared a grilled artichoke to start and I'm still thinking about it today.  It was that good.  Prepared perfectly and paired with a pesto aioli dipping sauce.  We both loved it.  Then we had the mushroom soup...I'm not huge on mushrooms, so I was hesitant to try it, but Hannah highly recommended it and I'm so glad she did.  It was so tasty!  Our entrees were awesome too; salmon and the ribeye.  I could honestly go on and on; we had such a positive experience and we'll definitely be back!

We popped in on Saturday night around 8pm thinking we would have no trouble getting a seat in the heat of the summer but it was packed!  We sat at the bar, which was lovely and quite comfortable and enjoyed a great glass of wine and dinner.  We had not tried Paul Martins yet and we were not surprised at how good it was.   I had the salmon salad which I am afraid I will now be craving.  Clearly the fish was fresh.  My husband had the steak frites and it also was beautifully presented and delicious.  Service was friendly but professional.  Great atmosphere inside.  Not too noisy, but kind of a cool vibe.  Great food, of which the menu states is locally sourced as much as possible.  The happy hour menu looked fabulous with a smoked salmon that the couple sitting next to us raved about.  Lots of options price wise and a very nice menu for those watching their health as well as those wanting to splurge on delicious cuts of beef.  Wine list for the by the glass was excellent.

Ate here last night for the first time. Had a 7:30 reservation but the manager  let us know right away that he was just waiting for a table to clear out. Turned out to be longer than expected so he graciously set us up outside on a couch with drinks and appetizers. Not something you see much anymore. We sat down around 8::30. Our waiter was great and the manager made sure to check on us. My husband had the fish tacos and they were great! Drinks were always poured! We will be back in the future. Again, thanks to the restaurant for taking care of the longer wait.

We had a fantastic late lunch here.  Go for happy hour, 3-6pm.  The chicken sandwich is one of the best I've had.  My daughter enjoyed her burger.  The cucumber refresher cocktail is a perfect cool down on a hot afternoon.

The dining room is comfortable, decorative and modern. I had an enjoyable dinner. I ordered a field greens salad with tomato, red onion, avocado, cucumber, radish, sunflower seeds and house vinaigrette. I had Columbia River Steelhead Salmon with housemade lemon vinaigrette and chilled quinoa salad with arugula. Later, I ordered Toasted Almond Cake that had ladyfingers soaked in Amaretto, Italian Mascarpone, crushed amarettini cookie with chocolate chips. This was a light and refreshing meal with good service

This place knows how to train their staff!  Outstanding wait service!  It was comparable to a 5 star restaurant!  The food was excellent and we were informed about the menu including they make everything from scratch using the freshest local ingredients, depending on what is available seasonally.  Really enjoyed this experience!

Excellent service, food and ambience! My friend and I went for a late ladies lunch on a Tuesday ! Restaurant was not busy, which was nice and quiet!  Since it was so late in the day we opted to split a meal and a side. We ordered the fish tacos and cauliflower side. Dustin our server who has been with this restaurant since they opened three years ago -was excellent. Very friendly and terrific service! I've been here many times but my friend had not and she loved it too!

We went on a Monday night and it was packed! The food was amazing! I had the Salmon with Brussels sprouts - yum. i loved it! and my friend had the braised ribs and those were delicious as well . loved it , cant wait to go back!!!

So my mom told me about this place and insisted we get happy hour together there, and when my mom likes a restaurant, it's kind of a big deal because she's pretty picky. My boyfriend and I met my parents there for happy hour the other week. It's wonderful that the HH goes until 8PM because my boyfriend works late so he was finally able to make it to a HH!   We got to sit out on the patio in the comfy cushioned chairs. I really need to remember to start writing down our servers' names because he was fantastic.   We ordered from the "Taste of Paul Martin's Menu" which is their way of saying Happy Hour. My boyfriend ordered the St. Louis Style Pork Ribs and I ordered the $13 special which comes with a burger (there's 3 choices available), fries (sweet potato, regular, or mixed), and a beer...all for $13!! The burger was very very yummy and incredibly juicy.   Not one of us left a scrap of food on our plates. I had a chance to check out their full menu and it looks like a place I definitely want to come back to and try out.   Happy hour = fantastic. Full dining experience = forthcoming.

I went to Paul Martin's on Sunday evening to try out their Sunday prime rib special based on the recommendation of some family members who enjoyed the prime rib on a prior visit. The Sunday special is only $25 and includes an organic green salad, prime rib with mashed potatoes, and homemade ice cream for dessert.  Green salad - surprisingly, I really enjoyed the salad. I thought the vinaigrette was delicious (it was a sweet/sour dressing) and enjoyed the mixture of greens.   Prime rib - Very large portion. I ordered my prime rib medium rare and thought it was cooked well. Although the edges of the prime rib were more medium/well-done than medium rare, there was a lot of meat and I was pretty full by the end of the entree. In fact, I had them box some to go. I would have preferred a little more seasoning, especially since it started to get a little bland by the time I finished half the prime rib. However, I think it's well worth the price and definitely filling.  Ice cream - There were three scoops of ice cream: vanilla, chocolate, and their seasonal ginger bread. The ice cream was good (I enjoyed the vanilla the most), but again, there wasn't anything particularly "wow" factor about the dessert.  Service: This is where I had the biggest issue with my dinner at Paul Martin's. On multiple occasions we had to remind our waiter that one of our party had a food allergy and could not eat the dessert. Our waiter then misheard the type of food allergy we specified and we had to restate the allergy. Furthermore, we bought a gift card on that same day and were told by the waiter that he wasn't sure if we could use the gift card despite the fact that we had been told by the manager that we could. (I honestly have no idea why a restaurant would have problems with us using their gift card.) We then had to wait for the waiter to go check with the manager (who we had already talked to) and come back to inform us that, yes, of course we could use the gift card.   However, during the meal itself, the waiter did a good job checking in with us and asking about the food.  I'm giving this 3 stars because although I did not think the food was particularly mind-blowing, I thought it was a great deal for the price and very filling. As a side note, I have not had the opportunity to try other foods besides the prime rib special. I docked a star for the service.

Talk about a great place... The atmosphere is really nice.. They have a splendid outdoor patio for happy hour...  The happy hour menu is solid for food and drinks.. 5 buck mojitos...  We enjoyed dinner as well.
Great fish tacos and calamari with excellent service. But outrageous prices especially for beverages/wine.  If you go, stick with water.

Tried it because of the Amex deal ($25 back on $50).  Solid 3.  Good service.  Nice decor. Overpriced drinks that I guess were not on happy hour.  Like that the menu changes.  Too much butter on the fish and spinach!  To many places to go back any time soon.
Best braised short ribs and wait staff anywhere! Joel and Courtney are the best! Amazing food and staff.

Ask and you shall receive!  We didn't have to ask for GREAT customer service today-but it was handed to us on a silver platter.  Paul was our delightful server-and he intuitively responded to our needs, whether we overtly stated them or not.  If I said I like lemons-we received a bowl of lemons for our drinks, when I had difficulty choosing between an Almond Cake or Chocolate Cake for dessert, and ultimately chose the Almond selection-Paul brought an additional bowl of chocolate sauce for the optional drizzle.  When we were leaving-he promptly delivered our two iced teas to go-to quench us in the climbing heat.  It was nice to be taken care of-without asking.  My hubby enjoyed the Bleu Cheese Burger, oozing cheesy goodness, served on a perfect bun and accompanied by crispy fries. I opted for the Grilled Shrimp Butter Lettuce Salad-a lighter fare to justify dessert later.  Both were delicious and satisfying to our individual tastebuds.  We will be back-and we will ask for Paul-easy to remember-maybe his last name is Martin!  Wink!

I have never had a poor experience at Paul Martin's, the service is impeccable.  The manager both seated us and brought our wine.  The food is incredible, I haven't had a meal that was less than exceptional.  It functions as a well oiled machine.  Everything about Paul Martin's is superb, I ALWAYS look forward to my next visit.
Really oily food lacking the great seasonings to make up for it.  The calamari didn't have the light breading as advertised and was over-fried.  That's all I remember.

The decor of this place is really nice.  They have black and white photos of food hanging on the walls everywhere that really make you hungry!  I also like their private "room" in the back for larger parties.  I put room in quotations bc the table is separated from the rest of the dining area by thick curtains.  Unfortunately, I was a bit disappointed with the entree I ordered: chimichurri steak with fries.  The steak was flavorless, or if it did have any flavor, it was overpowered by the STRONG charred flavor from the outside of the steak.  Basically, all I was tasting was something charred, with the texture of a steak on the inside.  And I ordered my steak medium rare so there was no reason for it to be so charred.  After a few bites I asked my friend if she liked the steak (she ordered the same thing as me) and she said it tasted fine, so maybe it was just me.  But she also likes her steaks well done with no pink inside at all.  Anyway, I didn't even finish half of it and just took the leftovers home to my dogs.  My dogs gave the food 5 stars!  But they also eat grass and sometimes their own poop, so that's not saying much.  On top of the overwhelming char flavor, the oil from the food (I'm assuming from the chimichurri sauce) was all over the plate.  It was too much oil!  and it was getting underneath the fries and making them soggy with oil.  Mergh, for $21 I expected more.  I did appreciate that they had regular parking, as well as a valet.  I hate places where you are forced to valet your car.

Came for soft opening night for family and friends. So far everything I have tried is excellent. Definitely will be coming back. Eric the Best bartender in Scottsdale! Very courteous and professional knows all answers about the drinks and food n is very attentive and knows his job and does an excellent job at it. Keep up the great work guys!

MUCH Improved!!!  I had a pretty unpleasant experience dining at Paul Martin's some time ago. I believe it was not too long after they opened. The only thing that lured me back to try again was their 3 course Sunday Prime Rib Special.  It is a beautiful venue, and since it wasn't very busy, I decided to sit at the bar where service would be pretty much captive. From the moment that I sat down, the Bar Tender, Dustin, took excellent care of my dining experience. He was on top of everything. In addition, this time, my food was excellent.   The Prim Rib started with a salad course, then there was a main course of perfectly cooked prime rib and mashed potatoes, and finally three scoops of their house made ice cream, with a couple of out of this world sugar cookies.   The last time I was at Paul Martin's, the salad was so poorly executed and poorly dressed that, since no one came back to check on me after leaving it, I had to resort to making up for the missing dressing with salt. Not so this time! It was perfectly dressed and delicious! Also, because Dustin continuously checked back with me, if there had been anything amiss, I know it would have been tended to.   When I cautiously asked for my Prime Rib rare, he assured me that they would prepare it any way that I would like - and they did! The Prime Rib was delicious, even if I didn't quite get their take on creamy horseradish sauce. It was a little too adulterated with other ingredients, and I couldn't taste the horseradish. I'm not a purist, but when asked, Dustin brought me a little dish of plain horseradish. Perhaps it was house made in some off beat way. It didn't taste like horseradish either, and had absolutely no bite,. That was OK though, the Prime Rib was just fine on its own. The mashed potatoes with the Prime Rib were delicious!  Finally, full as I was, I gave in to the house made ice cream. It was the creamiest ice cream I have ever tasted. Along with it were served the most wonderful "melt in your mouth" sugar cookies, with coarse sugar around the edges. I wasn't even close to finishing the ice cream when I had to give up, but I wrapped my other cookie up in a cocktail napkin and took it home for later. No way was I going to leave that cookie behind.  So I had a delicious, well orchestrated meal, and Dustin completely made my experience far and away better than my previous visit. I will definitely be eating at the bar from now on.
The calamari and fried salt & pepper shrimp were freaking (not cussing) good. Had it last night and the leftover still good with my bbq ribs. Coleslaw ehhh. No likey coleslaw. Will come again.

The waiter came to take some plates from our table and I literally told him, "If you touch mine you'll lose a finger!"  Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. We've been to great restaurants (Ramsey's, Nobu, etc.). This was a hidden gem. We'll be back.
Hmm the happy hour menu looks great but I  cannot understand why none of it is served during dinner hours. Basically ruining my entire decision to ever return here.

We made reservations on opentable for this place for my 6 yr. Anniversary dinner for the main reason that their menu shows that they focus on healthy eating and the foods change with the seasons. When we arrived we were greeted and sat down right away. The ambience this location has is so warm and comfortable, within minutes we had water at our table and a welcoming waitress asking what she can get us to drink. I stuck with water but my wife and our friend got a beer and I ordered the salt and pepper shrimp as our appetizer. (Yes, we had a friend come along to our anniversary dinner since afterward we were heading to a concert.) The waitress was so friendly and was quick to answer all the questions we had after bringing our drinks back. As we were getting ready to order the shrimp arrived and they were so delicious, They were perfectly seasoned and fried. I ordered the Cajun ribeye and it did not disappoint!!! I absolutely loved it. It was cooked to perfection and so juicy. For dessert we got the Ice cream on top of this cake thing... HAHAHA, don't know what it was called but I pretty much ate the whole thing. I gave my wife a bit and luckily our friend didn't want to try it which I was ok with because it meant more for me. The restaurant has warm and comfortable vibe to it, you can be dressed up or casual and it feels right either way. The cost wasn't that bad either for the amazing food we had!! Usually for healthy option restaurants you have to accept youll have to pay for what you get, in my opinion we got a smoking deal!!! To top it off the staff is amazing, they were so kind and welcoming... We will definitely be making a trip back soon, maybe once the menu changes so we can try something new!
We love the food and Courtney is he best waiter in town! He always makes us feel so special. It is one of our go-to restaurants in Scottsdale!
Great service, great food, great atmosphere! Enjoyed the sweet potato fries and ribs, brick chicken was real good.

We were visiting from  California. I love artichokes. The choke here was the best I ever had!  The beef in the French dip was so tender and tasty. The au juis was too salty. My wife had the fried chicken special.  Great deal. Fried chicken was good. The service was professional and courteous.

Shared the Calamari, Blackened Ribeye, Short Ribs, Cedar Plank Salmon and Fish Tacos.  Can not start to tell you how much we loved everything about Paul Martins. Each dish was better than the previous one. The Blackened Rib Eye was prepared spot on and very juicy.  Loved the Calamari with the crisp batter but not dry and it being the real deal.  The Cedar Plank Salmon was also prepared well and very tasty.  Bread soft and fresh and the butter was soft and easy to apply to the bread  A small but detailed touch were the leftovers had written on each container what was in the box.  Absolutely loved this restaurant and will be back.
